description:
Here's good service. Ordered late night munchies. Here about 20 minutes before scheduled time. Super cool driver. Get a call from the place concerned that they might not have delivered the awesome calamari I was currently stuffing my face with. 
Grubby late night food and service you don't experience often this late. 
Much appreciated.
author: Fabian F.

description:
Sf can boast of some horrible shawarma, but Fresco Pizza and Shawarma (and burgers and whatever else) on Polk/Pine is by far the worst. The $12 lamb pita is MUTTON at best, tough and grizzled like an old angry ram. The pizza is not that great either. If you're out after bars on Polk St. with the munchies, keep walking. Go to Mustafio's for a big $5 slice of Neapolitan style pizza. 

Also remember (even though you're most likely too drunk) to avoid Piccadilly's fish and chips right next door to "Fresco" Shawarma's, per my other review. This part of Polk street is really awful for decent late night food, so if you're here you're screwed. Around the corner on Pine St. is Grubsteak, but they fleece you every time. Good luck.
author: Amy R.

description:
Ok.  I order from this place when I come home after a late night.

EVERY time, the next day, I get food poisoning.  Every time!!  Shame on them, what is going on Fresco Pizza? And this is not the first review with such complaints.  

And shame on me for being too drunk when I order to remember it was this place that gives me food poisoning.  

That aside, food is kinda tasty.  But I prefer to be healthy.
author: Penelope C.

description: Bomb!!!! The best pizza! Came here straight from Los Angeles! I recommend it to anyone traveling and anyone traveling here
author: Bobby O.

description: The pesto chicken sandwich was superb! It was a big sandwich and I was only able to eat half. I would definitely stop by during my next visit to San Francisco.
author: Miguel O.

description:
Worst delivery experience ever! Late, rude and left my food at the front desk of my building without asking/telling me. I live in the heart of downtown, if I wanted to go downstairs for my food, I wouldn't order delivery!!

Fresco - your food is too good to have individuals like this represent your organization.

Also my $9.00 sandwich was all smashed up.. 

Thank you!
author: Kenny E.

description:
Owner is very welcoming and accommodating, they didn't have plain cheese when I came in but they made a whole pizza just for my one slice request!
Pizza looks and tastes delicious and they are open until 3am! What?!?! Great for a late night munch, after parting or working late. Their menu is fantastic and extensive, they pretty much make anything from salads, to shawarma and kebab sandwiches and plates, furthermore falafel and Mediterranean foods plus a variety of pizzas, calzones and many desserts, including a classic cheesecake, rice pudding or baklava!!! They even have breyers and Ben and Jerry ice cream! WOW! I have been in this neighborhood for a while and I am wondering why have I not come here before?! They also offer free delivery with a minimum order of 15$! 
Just the best! Open from 11 am to 3 am daily.
author: Hosna A.

description:
Unexpectedly walked into FPS after walking around Polk street. I got the Golden Boy vibes with everyone was getting their pizza fix on.

Lo and behold, I see one of the employees go to town on a shawarma and I quickly scratched the notion of getting a slice of pizza. 

After waiting for the chef to cook up the lamb shawarma, the finished product came out and I proceeded to chow down. What an amazing find -- one of the better shawarma's I've had in the city. The meat was marinated to a T and had a nice balance of spice and tzatziki sauce all around. 

The folks who run FPS are good guys and asked for an honest opinion on their food. I would easily recommend the shawarma here -- still need to give their pizza a go here.
author: Sam K.

description: This place is great! No granted I've only had the falafel wrap, that was fresh and delicious! And they deliver late?! Get outta here. That's Awesome! Super pleasantly surprised.
author: William F.

description: Delivery doesn't take long . Nice chicken kebab . Only the complaint that's when you order from Grubhub they never read instruction and never add extra meat . Otherwise good place
author: Jo S.

description:
I ordered from Fresco Pizza through grubhub and was very pleased. The Falafel plate portion size and flavors were delicious and healthy. I have yet to try the pizza, but judging from the photos I would like to order some next time. I definitely plan to order from Fresco again.

Cheers.
author: Naresa H.

description:
I had a slight of the Vegetarian pizza it was delicious and good , one slight is enough for one person & it's very cheap $4.5 
I like it I'll go again to try something else
author: Mustafa A.

description:
FOOD POISONING BEWARE:

I came into town for an interview and Fresco was one of the only places open.

Ordered a side of fries with feta cheese and a chicken/beef shawarma plate. Shawarma rice/vegetables tasted a bit funny so I am suspecting that.

5 hours after eating I vomited most of the food back up.

For the next few days I experienced symptoms consistent with Norovirus (stomach flu). Fever, diarrhea, back pain, headache.


Eat at your own risk, reported to the department of health services.
author: Joe P.

description: One of the worst pasta and meatball dishes I have ever had.like canned ravioli. And for 15.00 I could have bought case.
author: Geoff K.

description:
My wife and I were staying at a waterfront hotel in San Francisco on a Wednesday night. We decided to order food delivered to our hotel at 10:40pm. We called and placed our order, were advised that it might take 30-45 minutes and we agreed. We waited one hour and called to check on our order. They told us our order was on the way and would arrive in fifteen minutes. We waited and called back fifteen minutes later. By now it was midnight so we called back and were now told they were too busy to made our order and then hung up on us.

We found another restaurant and ordered food using GrubHub. We finally got something to eat about 1am.
author: Dennis M.

description:
I was craving Mediterranean food for lunch and wanted to check out a new spot. I've seen Fresco Pizza Shawarma on Eat24 for the past couple of years or so. Since they serve the two things I was looking for: an appetizer and a meat sampler, I decided to order delivery last Sunday, July 24th. I placed the order at 12:06pm an it arrived at 1:02pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

*Mixed Appetizer Platter: Combination plate of hummus, baba gannoush, tabouli, ezme, potato salad, eggplant salad ($14.99), Extra Pita (+$0.75)
*Mixed Grill: Mixed grill consists of chicken and lamb shish kebob, kotte kebab, green salad, hummus ($18.99)

The baba ghanoush and tabbouleh were the best things about the meze platter. The tabouli added a nice green freshness to every bite and the baba gannoush was savory and creamy. The hummus, however, was very bland. Didn't have much flavor which was disappointing. Out of all the apps, I figured I'd like the hummus the best. The eggplant was all bad. I'm not sure how this is normally prepared, but it was slimy with a snotty texture. Really unappealing. I didn't try the potato salad and I didn't see any ezme, but I'm not familiar with ezme, so maybe it was there?

Also, the Eat24 app requires you to order extra pita with the mixed appetizer sampler. I believe this is a glitch as I realized later, the Eat24 site doesn't require you to do that. So save the extra $0.75 and go online to order as the pita was a little hard. I didn't even end up using on of the pitas I got anyways, so it was a waste. The mixed grill was a little better. All the meats had a nice smokiness. And surprisingly, I really liked the rice. The hummus with the mixed grill was also flavorless though.

Very disappointing mezze platter. And the mixed grill was just okay. This may be a good spot for late night eats like a shawarma or a slice of pizza, but for straight up Mediterranean food, Fresco fell a little short.
author: Elena N.

description: Worst food ever. The cheeseburgers tasted liked garbage. They charged us for ranch and fries and never got them. Complained how bad food was and they drove back to get the food and only credited 25%. Never order from this place.
author: Ann-Marie M.

description:
Great pizza place late at night, by the slice. Super convenient location on Polk after hitting the bars, under $5 for most slices, what else could you ask for?

They also have amazing huge breadsticks.
author: Ed M.

description:
My first time ordering and I used Amazon Restaurants.

Combo Shish Kebab - Chicken, Lamb
Comes with rice, salad, pita and hummus but I asked for extra salad instead of rice.
-The salad itself consists of these yummy shreds of lettuce and pickled red cabbages with red onion and a nice lemony flavor. 
-The Kebabs were both well seasoned and moist. Loved the char on the outside.
- The Hummus was actually a little flavorless, but the rest of the combo made up for it, I think. It went well smeared on the soft pita with the salad.

The Dolmas
-The rice inside was very soft, almost porrige-like in consistency so meh to that mouth feel. It did have a nice flavor though... I felt like there was a good amount of herbs present, maybe dill, and some lemon. I loved that it didn't come swimming in olive oil like most places. 

Overall would give a 4.5 but Yelp doesn't do halfsies.

Would order again. Or stop in.
author: Angela S.

description:
The food is always great and usually arrives before the time told. The majority of my orders are to this place for the chicken shawarma plate.

The plate itself is amazing but one time I ordered extra meat and extra hot sauce and didn't receive them. That's the only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars.

The pita bread is also good.
author: Mario M.

description: Just got my first delivery from them, and am so stoked I'm actually reviewing the shit. My chicken shawarma was damn delicious with a great acid/fat balance. Kudos on hot sauce and pickled red cabbage. Tasty late night options that aren't total gut bombs.
author: Katie J.

description: Looove their pizza it is a must after the bar or for a date in the afternoon!!! It's so cute! Like seriously please come here and eat the pizza!!  Super cute atmosphere!!! Love love loooooove iiiittt!!!
author: Hannah M.

description: This was the only place open at 12:30am on a Sunday. We ordered a  deep dish cheese pizza and we were disappointed when we got it that it wasnt the deep dish pizza like Chicago style Deep Dish Pizza. It was just regular cheese pizza with cheese filling in the crust. There was nothing Deep Dish about it, it was misleading. It was okay good.
author: Reena B.

description: Staying at a nearby hotel...ordered twice. Food was remarkably good..the hot sandwiches were amazing because of the bread... second order was a little different because the delivery guy didn't have change of a $20, so he got a $17 tip...and he was SOOOO HOT that I would have given him another $20... Seriously, he is one of the sexiest middle eastern dudes I have ever seen..thanks Fresco for the delicious meals, and entertainment!
author: Scott F.

description: Delivery took two hours from the time I ordered and the food arrived ice cold. What's worse is the deliver guy was surly and not apologetic about it. I'm not sure what the dine in experience is but I don't advise that you order delivery.
author: Manny F.

description:
Got home late and decided to try out this neighborhood hole in the wall pizza place which also happen to serve Kebob plates.  

Pretty much a take out joint, but you have a couple tables to sit and chomp down.   
Wipe your own table and dump your tray content in the trash.  Self service water and condiments on a the side.

Dishes were filling and flavorful - a solid 3.5 for food.

Got a 1 time 15% off yelp check-in so it helped the value I got out of it.  4 star this round.   

Will need to check out the pizza one of these days.
author: Drew B.

description:
Awesome joint that stays open till late! 

Even offered to add mushroom to cheese!!! ( because they didn't have the regular mushroom)

Right across from Play land which makes it even more awesome!
author: Pritha H.

description: This is probably my favorite restsurant the pizza n shawerma is just out of the world with reasonable prices i came my family twice n the staff is very courteous
author: Moiz F.

description: Only ordered through GrubHub and was very happy. Driver contacted me after i gave the wrong address and everything was STILL on time and delivered right to my hotel room. It is a bit more, but it was a fun weekend of pampering. Had a chicken shawarma, baklava, fries, and mozz sticks. Its perfect fourth meal/munchies/booze sponge food. They have healthier stuff, too. Thanks Fresco!
author: Chad L.

description:
Food was delicious I'll definitely be eating here again, but I'm only giving 3 stars because i asked for regular chicken shawarma but they gave me spicy shawarma also the delivery driver was very upset that I didn't give him a tip his attitude went from polite to go eff yourself real quick I would have tipped him but i only had enough money for the food. Hopefully next time i order he'll have a better attitude and i might have a tip for him.

Edit: went in twice in the same day because their food is just that good. Also the staff are very friendly. Without a doubt I will be returning here.
author: Naaim A.

description:
V good food. Worth the money.
We ordered pizza and shawarma.. tasted amazing. Piping hot and full of flavour. A must try when u r in downtown.
author: Muj Q.

description: I had an amazing experience and the food was amazing. I cannot recommend a better pizza place than here. Living in SF for over a year, this has been my go-to for pizza.
author: Raymond D.

description: SO...DELICIOUS! Mon beau and I stopped here back in May 2016 (a bit late in reviewing). I don't remember what we got but I remember it was good. Would totally come back and highly recommend this place!
author: Fauzia N.

description: Best pizza I have ever tasted!!!! I'm from Vegas I wish we had this out in Las Vegas Nevada.
author: Jose L.

description: This is probably my favorite place to go for pizza and shawarma. I love their chicken shawarma it's the best . I also order beef and chicken combo after leg day . The prices are affordable. I drive all the way from Daly City to this shawarma place. They are open until 2 am in the morning . The stuff is very friendly and lastly you can place an order before the pick up .
author: Homaira K.

description: I had a crazy diarrhea from their chicken wings, didn't even go to work next day. Stay away from this place if you value your life. Nowadays I go to Piccolo Italian Pizzeria, more professional n quality food.
author: Mfed I.

description:
Love this place.

Opened late and we came here after some drinks. Great customer service and pizza
author: Richard C.

description:
Saw the flyer in my hotel along with 2 others. After reviewing the locations, the ratings and items available, my family and I choose Fresco. 

We ordered the Golden Gate Deal as the flyer stated it has an X-Large 18" pizza (2 toppings), 2 Liter of Soda and 10 Hot Wings for $29.99. They had free delivery, but so did all the other places.

They guy who took my order said it would be 45 minutes, okay good deal. When he asked for my address, I told him the name of the hotel, he said "oh yea" and gave me the address. I'm thinking okay we made a good choice.

The food arrived within the 45 minutes. It was the X-Large pizza, 2 Liter soda and 8 chicken wings, for $34.99, not 10 Hot wings, 8 chicken wings. I gave $40 before I realized that the order wasn't exact. 

Now if you've seen any of my reviews you KNOW, I'm all about the service. That is how you do business. So tell me why my order was incorrect, and we did not get any napkins, plates, cups ....anything but you know we're in a hotel room?

My kids were hungry we didn't have time to play with Fresco's, we ran down stairs to get some supplies from the front desk, so that everyone didn't have to eat with their hands and feet, shit. But to finish it all, the food was mediocre. I'm sure if I were drunk, that shit would've been fire, like some of the other reviewers suggest. But like I said we were hungry, just not hungry enough to be good.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Great place, good customer service. 
Except from the topping on the pizza, everything else is halal and delicious. 
Plus it's open till 3 am so if you are hungry at night , like I am right now, having chicken shwarma and enjoying it with a 7up so this is a good place to go. :)
author: Edriss B.

description:
ORDER FAIL!

I just ordered via GRUBHUB (NOT RECOMMENDED as THEY ARE SNEAKY ON THEIR DISCOUNTS) but the order receipt was correct.

I ordered hot mozzarella sticks with marinara. I received COLD mozzarella sticks with RANCH DRESSING?! #orderfail1

I ordered ready-to-eat cheesecake. I received FROZEN when-am-I-supposed-to-eat-this cheesecake.#orderfail#2

I expect a full refund by the restaurant and this serves as the request.
author: Sharon M.

description:
The chicken shawarma pizza was incredible! So much flavor, plentiful amounts of topping. I loved it!

The chicken wings and fries were top-notch, too. The fries in particular were delicious.

This place opens late, too! All positives.

The big problem I had was in the timing of getting my food. Prior to going to this restaurant, I was all the way down in 25th and Portrero, 12 minutes away from the restaurant. I placed my order online before leaving, got the order confirmation and everything. I travel to the restaurant and wait like 10 minutes in my car because hey, they might not be ready, right?

But when I go in, I go to the bathroom, which takes another 5 minutes because some dude who just turned 21 was destroying the toilet with memories of his first legal drinking experience.

And when I finally get to the cash register...the restaurant has apparently only received my order 5 minutes prior to me going to the cash register...? ...what? I've been waiting for my food for 27 or so minutes, and they tell me my order just showed up 5 minutes ago?

They told me to wait another 10 minutes for the pizza. I wait 10. I go back inside. Only for the pizza to take another 5 minutes. Then the fries take 5 more minutes.

So in total my food took 47 minutes to get. This was really, really inconvenient. I'm not sure if tonight might have just been a super-crowded day, but man. That was a really long wait.

(But if you happen to get lucky enough to not go during a peak hour you'll have delicious food in a timely manner, I hope!)
author: Gabriel R.

description: So good. I had a vegetable slice and a Chicken Shwarma. Food is fresh and made with great ingredients. Service was above and beyond. I will absolutely be ordering from Fresco Pizza Shwarma again. Great food and customer service.
author: Nathan S.

description: Fresco is my go-to pizza joint in NobHill. I always end up here for a few slices and french fries everytime my tummy screams FOOOOD after a night out. The workers are hard working people and so nice to me even when I'm drunk out of my mind. Their philly cheesesteaks is delicious as well. Highly recommend Fresco especially for drunk eats. I believe they close around 3am.
author: Nathan L.

description: Good quality, friendly owner, fast! Chicken tasted good. I reallly enjoyed how efficient the crew was
author: Brian T.

description: Who the heck wants to wait 45 mins for any Oder. And don't ever order any pizza ( they just keep the pizza Slice in oven just to make you happy) they serve fucking cold pizza slices. And forget falafels.
author: Vamsi T.

description: I loved this place. Veggie pizza amazing! Thank you for some great pizza! Line wasn't long. Loved it. Celebrated my friends birthday there. Amazing! Sensational! So good!
author: Saurabh S.

description:
I order the Beef Shawarma with Greek salad and humas on Eat24

So where to start. 
The beef shawarma was ground hamburger fried with onions and peppers and poorly spiced. So that's not shawarma! 
There was nothing about the salad that was Greek unless is iceberg lettuce and croutons with something that looked like French dressing has been adopted by the Greeks. 
The rice was a bright yellow normally meaning a seasoning of saffron or turmeric and cooked with chicken broth. None of this was detectable from the flavor and greasy mouth feel. 
The humas was just poor with no seasoning, garlic, or salt, and it was thin. 

A very poorly prepared meal at any price @ $25 with tax delivery and tip!
author: SV L.

description: Our go-to late-night delivery place. Pizza dough is soft, unique and yummy. Plus...Ben and Jerry's Ice Cream! Their Mediterranean is good but usually we order the pizza late night. Friendly and prompt delivery.
author: Arabella D.

description:
We arrived at our hotel late night, starving, and this pizza place was recommended by the hotel staff because they deliver until 3:00 am, so we decided to go for it. They delivered right to our hotel and it was delicious! The crust was soft and so good, and the sauce was very flavorful. By the way, I was completely sober also. They also only took 30 minutes to our door!
I would definitely eat again.
author: Cali M.

description: This was the only place opened at 11:30pm. Had the beef kabob plate. Food arrived surprisingly fast and was still hot! Two stars for that. The food was ok. Meat wasn't very flavorful or tender, was a little over cooked. Think it's a good place to get a late night meal but other than that it's too pricey for being so flavorful-less.
author: Monique L.

description: Was hesitant about the spot but it's actually pretty great for my lunch break. I go at least 2-3 times a week. Burger lunch combo is a good, fast meal and the pizza slices are nice and big. Just be sure to look at the slices that are out and tell them exactly which one you want, some are much fresher than others, but they are good about letting you pick the exact slice you want and heating it up in the oven before taking it out.
author: Deriuk S.

description: Had the chicken garlic sandwich. The cheese was gooey and abundant, the chicken a little dry but the cheese made up for it. The veggies were fresh and I ordered while it was late at night and no customers around. For the price I got a huge sandwich that was tasty. Hard to find in SF. Don't know why this place had a low rating. Will repeat frequently
author: Ryan L.

description: AWFUL SERVICE ... the owner is a creep ... he offered the girls in our group free pizza if ..........
author: Arash M.

description: Stick with me on this one... the flavor and portion size were awesome! We ordered 2 chicken shawarma sandwiches for delivery. It took an hour for delivery, and food wasn't hot so I would definitely recommend picking up if possible.  The center of both sandwiches were full of pickled cabbage... 3 or 4 bites worth. Also, I always tip once food is delivered, but when I answered the door, the delivery guy handed me the bag and walked off! I said, "Hey, I was going to sign the paper and tip you." Hid reply was, " it doesn't work like that"... that was it! Would have gotten 4 stars had we him had about 1/2 and sandwich's worth of cabbage, 5 stars had the delivery guy not been rude.
author: Kalynne M.

description: Amazing pizza made fresh and hands down best Shawerma I've had in San Francisco! I've explored all of San Francisco and Fresco's is a must!!!
author: Alex B.

description: This place is  awesome!!! 5 min walk form my house , sooooo convinent! And they're open HELLA late!!! Owner is really nice too and they have a wide variety of different foods! Great Prices!
author: Gavin H.

description: Ordered chicken shawarma platter and 4 falafel balls via Amazon Prime Now. Delivered in 33 min flat, everything was great and large portion.
author: Jordan C.

description: Great service! Amazing food!! 10/10 would recommend. Great selection of food. Even has awesome deserts and is open late. Come check it out!
author: Clorissa C.

description: Just had our order delivered onto our hotel. The pizza was good and the cheese bread was also good.  However, they were a bit on the cold side. I understand it was delivered, but it could have been warmer. As for the salad (lettuce, tomato & Italian dressing), well, it was salad.  I'm giving it 3 stars because we were not given plates, napkins nor a fork for the salad.
author: Maggie H.

description:
I freaking love this place. I was randomly looking for a place to deliver hummus around 1 a.m & I got lucky with fresco!! I was iffy about the hummus first since I mostly know them as a pizza place but omg I'm so glad I went with my gut!! I ordered hummus , and mozzarella sticks with extra hummus and extra pita . I mostly wanted just the hummus but they have a delivery minimum so I got the other stuff but wow! I absolutely love the hummus!!! It's more on the citrus side but it's absolutely amazing! So before I had ordered from this place I wasn't quite sure where it was located but I thought I had seen it before,  so one day while walking down on Polk Street I ran past it so I decided to stop by and grab my friend & myself a little tub of hummus ;) best thing ever!!! She loved it as well! And OK so the other night I got off work kind of late and I was craving that hummus again so I ordered super late and they ordered within 30 minutes!!!! I ordered this time with rice pudding which is to die for!! They melt some type of caramel on top that makes it more amazing u must try yourself!! Well thank you so much fresco for being so wonderful and keep up all that good hummus I will definitely be your regular customer!! thank you!!!




UPDATE : hummus recipe was changed . I repeat HUMMUS RECIPE WAS CHANGED! Why??? No flavor in new recipe . Please change back. I know you guys changed it a while back but everytime I pass your spot im sad and miss the old hummus. Please change it back ! Thank you !
author: Lupe V.

description: Pizza was great. Exactly what I needed after a night out. The pizza slices tasted amazing
author: Grant W.

description: I debated to give this place a 4 or a 5. I think I am reserving 5 for the best of the best of dining in SF. However, this place is likely a 5 of 5 for it being a pizza/middle eastern restaurant. I've been ordering for about 2 - 3 years. The baba g. is one of the best I have had, period hands down. The baklava is exceptional and fresh. The pizza has all been top notch.  I have been disappointed, once, just once with one dish - and after calling in, the crew made up for it in my next order.  Overall, lovely crew, great food, timely and responsive.
author: Rebecca G.

description: Just to counterbalance the poor delivery experiences, wanted to add that I had a great delivery  on a rainy night today. I placed my order through Grubhub and got a 10:20-10:30 delivery (~1 hour), and the driver showed up with piping hot food at 9:56, giving me a ring when he was a couple minutes away. Food was pretty great too!
author: Danny G.

description: Was craving some pizza and tried the pepperoni and Pesto chicken. Pretty good with great crust! Pizza was already out and needed to be reheated (which is usual) but did loose a little of the taste. I would come back if I had a quick pizza craving.
author: Run.It.Off V.

description: Great Pizza!!! Excellent boboli like crust. Barbecue chicken pizza was amazing!!! Definitely in the running for best pizza. Had it delivered for free, fast, fresh and hot.
author: Veronica L.

description: Ordered pizza at 12:15 am and the man said it would be delivered in 45 minutes. At 2:15 am the pizza has still not been delivered. What a joke. Time to go to sleep and let the delivery driver knock on the door a few times if he even comes. Don't order. The pizza cams and is a dough ball with barely any cheese and sauce. All crust. Dressing is the cheapest salad dressing. I mean come on, it's cheaper to buy vinegar, oil and dried oregano and make your own dressing than buy the cheapest Italian dressing.
author: Frank E.

description: Pizza is very nice and very tasty I just love it so yummy definately I wil come again
author: Waseem A.

description:
The latter part of my Thursdays involve heading to the airport from the Midwestern city I work in and catching a flight, running to make my connection at SLC, MSP, LAX or ATL and getting on a Taxi from SFO heading up to the city.

As I contemplate the week I had, I place delivery for dinner and Fresco happen to be my choice half the  time. I end up ordering the Shawarma Plate, Mixed Grill and the hot wings. 

The food arrives immediately after I get home and unpack. It arrives hot, tasty and fragrant. And 30 minutes later, I forgot I spent my entire week in Southern Ohio. Thank you, Fresco.

I will one day go to the restaurant to dine in, I have never been there.
author: Sadique A.

description: Got here around midnight after driving for 7 hours up from LA, and got the chicken shawerma pizza. It was pretty tasty, with good cheese and vegetables and crust. The chicken was okay, although it wasn't that shawerma-ey (sorry). The price was a bit high for our taste, around $25 for a large. We split the pizza 3 ways so that kind of lessened the impact on our wallet!
author: Abdurahman L.

description: pizza is amazing. garlic bread is a1. Place is lively with different people!! Love it here
author: Jamie E.

description: This place saved the day.  After making out with a complete stranger of a women who first smoked half a a broken cigarette off the ground and then preceded to destroy mine and my friends mouth with aggressive making out leaving our mouths crimson red for as long as it takes a groundhog to see it's shadow, this fine establishment really came through when it came to sustenance. The pizza was good. The fries were hot. The night was a success.
author: Nicholas B.

description: My favorite places in the area, because they have great schwarma and are open late.  =]
author: Jonathan K.

description:
Very sweet staff, crispy pita shawarma wraps and generous shawarma plates.
And heeeey they're open late and deliver late, and their baklava is the perfect amount of wet and crispy, and not sickeningly sweet- juuuust right
author: Sasha C.

description:
REALLY REALLY REALLY good shawerma and pizza and french fries!!!!!

I talked with the manager and they make all the sauces and ingredients at the restaurant.
The hidden gem is the baklava. Never had such moist and delicious baklava before.
author: Yunmi J.

description:
THEY SPIT IN YOUR FOOD!!!!

Terrible delivery service. Delivery man argued saying he refuses to park and come upstairs when i have a 101 temp flu. I live in a high rise apartment with plenty of parking in the front mind you. 

He proceded to spit in my hummus and try to lecture me when he came to my doorstep. 

Food is meh, delivery sucks.
author: Rohan K.

description: Really good food , they have great menu and the priceless are very good. We ordered our food 2:00am and it came really fast , this is my new favorite late night place to order from.
author: Nihad V.

description: Ordered delivery because we were too lazy to go out. Best decision we ever made. Kebabs were delicious, but the spicy sauce they sent along with the food really set it off. Rice was a little plainer than I would have liked but still good. I didn't get a dressing with my salad so I was a little disappointed about that.
author: Charles B.

description: last night i ordered hot wings they were cold garlic bread with cheese cold and my chicken in my salad was hard as a rock this place is horrible and i called back and asked for a extra ranch when the man delivered my food there wasnt a extra ranch in it and to think i tipped the guy never again will i order from mo way the food should have been cold when the parlor is about 7 minutes away from my job smh
author: Ebbie E.

description: If you're a fanatic for good sandwiches, this is the spot. It's not fancy. It's actually quite off putting tbh. But this is the only place in SF that has the right kind of bread to make the best sandwiches. And the crew is awesome. So don't let looks fool you. Pizza - is avg. but no place in SF can pump out good hot sandwiches like this place: cheesesteak (and I'm super picky, lots of time in philly), chicken garlic, etc. perfect bread.
author: Dominic C.

description: I was a little hesitant to order pizza from a middle eastern pizza place, but it was totally worth it! We ordered the deep dish/thick crust pizza, and the crust is stuffed with cheese. It was so soft and doughy and delicious! I had to take off a star because we asked for pepperoni on half and they put it on all of it (I'm a vegetarian so I had to pick pepperonis off my pizza -_-). Other than that, would really recommend this place!
author: Audrey M.

description: I wasn't expecting much when I walked into this place, however when I was handed a halal beef shwarma in under 20 minutes the food was spectacular and tasted amazing to boot. I will definitely be going back again to try out some of there other dishes. Reasonably priced for San Francisco. Thanks guys. Keep up the good work.
author: James A.

description:
-toppings are halal 
-paid $5 for a fully loaded slice (beef pepperoni, beef bits, green pepper). The slice was very pricey but it tasted good.
author: Ani N.

description: Walk in, order a spicy chicken schwarma wrap, sit down, listen to awesome Algerian music blasting while you wait, and then devour the delicious wrap freshly made!!! This is not a Lebanese style schwarma, so if you're expecting that you will be disappointed. It's YUMMY and reminded me of my travels in North Africa. Loved it! I'm not sure I would venture to order anything other than that here. Just listen to me and get it. Don't deliver. No wrap like that is going to translate well to 30-120 minutes later. Ever.
author: Jen B.

description: The store looked very quiet in the night. I was craving for pizza but I'm a vegetarian. My husband told me to get pizza from Victor which i had once and I thought it was fine, so i went to this place and got their veggie pizza. Surprisingly, they have good pizza! The thing is I'm not used to $5 for a slice of pizza. I think it somehow a little pricey.
author: Waraporn T.

description: Love the thick crust Hawaiian so good!!  Great service and have lots of yum sandwiches, wings, fries, desserts, shawerma
author: Sandra S.

description: This place is the closest to a dumpster. It is disgusting. The people here are not friendly and they have mocked me before. They are not helpful at all.
author: Elious S.

description: Great pizza and great flavors.  I lucked into this place and was very surprised I hit a nice place by chance.  I will be back for sure.  It was raining and I ducked into this place and it was slow, lots of takeout going out the door.  Very tasty.
author: Maxwell R.

description: Damn that's a boooooom ass pizza!!!!!! Like I'm ate joking! That pizzzzzza is da bomb
author: Stephen G.

description:
My goodness. One of best shawerma :)
Pizza is amazing as well.
I wish i have more room in my stomach to eat more :)
author: Phillip N.

description: First time here, my friend HIGHLY recommended ( and I've lived in sf for a looooooong time now) and This place did not disappoint! Super fast and friendly service - perfect for a post HH bite ;) or more! I got the chicken Schwarma, hummus, hot wings, pepperoni pizza, cheesecake AND, as if that wasn't enough --- a few bites of my friend's baklava. Heaven. My appetite is satisfied ;)
author: moni w.

description: The best deep dish pizza I've ever had ( no joke) from San Jose and staying in SF this week. So happy I found this place. Bread is so soft and fluffy. Will never get pizza anywhere else in SF again. Thank you Fresco keep doing what you're doing
author: andrew r.

description: THE BEST PIZZA ANY TIME OF ANY DAY! And the workers are amazing! Please try, you won't regret it!!
author: Anny V.

description:
The pizza here is a generous 2 stars, but the friendliness of the staff and the late-night hours definitely bump it up a star. 

This place gets major props for being open every night on Polk until 3am. 3AM!!! All I ordered here was the Hawaiian and the combo pizza around 11pm on a Sunday night. We were actually just passing by, but a couple workers were sitting outside and assured us that their food was delicious. In retrospect, I probably shouldn't have so readily believed two people who obviously worked there, but my hunger at the time was so overwhelming that we ended up going inside. 

You can't go too wrong with a pizza with generic toppings, but it's usually not great, either. The pizza was similar to Little Caesars, which is on the lower tier of pizzas for me. I might be back, but not for the quality of food -- only for the convenience of having something to drunkenly scarf down in the wee hours of the night. 

If you want a larger selection of pizza and you don't mind walking a bit, you might want to stop by Mustafio's (at Polk & Post, a few blocks down). They serve their slices hotter and yummier -- but they're only open to 2am instead of 3.
author: Christine L.

description: Very well done -- ordered rice (yellow rice), lentil soup and 4 falafel patties at $15 with charge.  Courteous delivery interaction, convenient mobile device card transaction appreciated to Clay St downtown hotel. Most of all fairly portioned, satisfying meal prepared with care (including lemon slice, nice added finish). Thank you.
author: Anthony L.

description:
Live a little! Go past the pizzas people and get the shawermas and the kebab plates! They are to die for. 
We ordered the lamb Shish kebab plate to start with and omg party in my mouth. The rice fragrant and fluffy, warm soft bread, killer hummus and the lamb, OMG the lamb! 
Of course, the bf and I needed more after that taste of the goods and got a combo shewarma. It was HUGE and super yummy. The hot sauce just perfect, the meat so moist and well spiced and oh so taaasstteyyy! 

I wish I stayed in SF just to visit this place when I crave Persian food. The staff is very courteous and helpful. 
Come flocking after that pub crawl on Polk st at midnight folks. It won't disappoint.

Update: Don't leave without some pistachio baklava! The owner gave us some complementary (free tastes sweeter, I know, but..) and it was pure joy. Not too sweet, the pastry was crispy yet soft and very flavorful. I would give them 10 stars if I could.
author: Meghna N.

description:
First time trying Fresco Pizza tonight (using the Foodler app). Menu was varied, so we had all ordered different things. 
Cheeseburger looked good, but my friend asked for no mayo and it had mayo on it. No big deal, he scraped it off!
Fish and chips was so-so, but since swarma is their specialty, fish and chips was kind of a dicey choice. 
Veggie special pizza we all agreed was fantastic and would definitely order again. 
A little key lime pie for dessert was a great finish. 
Overall great, and our delivery driver was super sweet. We ordered during rush hour and no parking around our apartment, so our driver let us know when he was on his way, and which direction he'd be coming from so we could grab our food quickly :-) 
Would definitely order again and maybe stick to their specialties!
author: Tami M.

description: This place is close to the bars and the philly chicken and philly steak sandwiches are delicious ( before OR after alcohol). Friendly service too :)
author: Ajay P.

description: Delicious hummus and shawarma! The chicken shawarma comes with a big tub of hummus that will last you for days. Or one day, if you're really into hummus.
author: Kerry S.

description: When all of the other pizza joints are closed at 11pm, this place stays open. It's the least fancy place that I've ever been to. You say "I want this and I want that" and then pay the guy less than 10 bucks and take your pizza and go back to your hotel room and watch Law and Order SVU, trolling Tinder, in an oversized t shirt and underwear, until you drift off into a gluten coma.
author: Alexa R.

description:
I love fresco 
Guys here so friendly and nice 
About the food especially shawarma is fantastic yummy and juice 
Order ready fast and clean 
And for dessert rice budding and baklava 
Thanks guys and I be back very soon
author: Shady A.

description: 5 stars for the food, but the delivery service for eat24 is terrible. I get the same delivery guy and he always demands cash tip, and I put in for the tip as another amount instead of the standard 10%, 15%, and so on. Customers are NOT obligated to tip, and even though I DID give a tip, this delivery man always seems to ask for a cash tip. It may be the website's fault too, but I clearly put in a tip and charged my card. He called me rude and while he was exiting my apartment complex he kept complaining. I love their food, but I will never order delivery again sadly because of this man's poor service and attitude.
author: Patricia E.

description:
I love this place. It's one of my favorite late night spots to get dinner from, and the delivery guys are always super friendly, and thoughtful! The food is solid comfort food. Sure, it isn't Michelin Star, or anything, but for the price, the food is delicious, filling, and worth both the cost and the wait.

I've said it once, and I'll say it again: I love this place. They'll continue to be one of my favorite places to come crawling to looooong after dark, looking for someone to feed me.
author: Red C.

description: Great pizza and great service!! Vegetarian was delicious! Great after a night out on Polk
author: Olivia O.

description: Avoid this rip-off establishment. Aside from bad pizza, I was charged $18.43 for a  deliivered pizza listed as $12.99 in their current doorstep brochure.
author: Gene W.

description: I love baklava and they had yummy ones, friendly service! Best place to go for a slice of pizza after the bar and I want the shawarma so good yum!
author: Sarah M.

description:
Amazing chicken kebab plate- chicken is tender, juicy, and grilled to perfection with red and green peppers, served with a Mediterranean salad & rice, and hummus & a sour cream based sauce on the side. So good and plenty of food- we split a plate tonight and both left stuffed. My husband and I come here all the time- used to stop by here when I lived in the neighborhood and we still come back even though we moved to Marin. 
Fizzy bubbly!!
author: Sharon K.

description:
Wow what a pleasant surprise to find a pizza place in Knob Hill that rivals the best pizza places I've been to in NY!! The crust is lightly crispy on the outside and just doughy enough on the inside, and the sauce is out of this world!!!  They finish it off with fresh toppings and an abundance of cheese! LOVED THIS PIE!!!!! I will definitely be back.  Everyone was so friendly and they are open Til 3 am I found out!! Not to mention the menu is so diverse with Italian, American, Middle Eastern and Greek favorites!! So impressed!!
 -Michelle Flight Attendant
author: Michelle B.

description: We were staying in a hotel near pier 39 and asked the front desk for a recommendation for a pizza restaurant, they recommended Fresco Pizza. When I ordered the person taking the order was extremely rude and I had to repeat my order several times. I asked for plates and napkins and after repeating my order he just hung up. I wasn't sure if my pizza was going to be delivered or not, I was never asked how I was going to pay for the pizza. So after 1 1/2 hours the pizza was delivered to our hotel, without any plates or napkins. The delivery driver said we needed to order the plates and napkins when we called and we informed him that we did, anyway the pizza was average at best. I was really disappointed by all the good reviews there was nothing special about this pizza. If I had a choice I would not order from this pizza restaurant!
author: Craig R.

description:
Best Med. food ever!!!! Lamb shawarma is what I think is best. People there are friendly and clean. I highly recommend it!!!
Thank you Jameel
author: Mazen A.

description: One of the best pizzas in SF plus a great, varied menu. Great food. Such an awesome find on Polk Street! Definitely check this place out asap.
author: Elizabeth A.

description: The best pizza and breadsticks !!! So happy we ran into this pizza place ! My boyfriend and I are from Salt Lake City and in search of the best pizza and we for sure found it !
author: Meghan K.

description: I love their pizza. It is by far the best pizza I have tried in San Francisco and they have FREE delivery. Great customer service too.
author: Indira A.

description:
I somehow found myself completely famished at 2:30am and checked out the few local options and decided a shwarma sandwich sounded great. But it closed at 3am, so I had to hurry. 

Double checked to confirm the closing time and both Yelp and their website (and it turns out the sign outside the restaurant!) say it closes at 3am. So I hurriedly got appropriately dressed, put lights on my bicycle, grab the bike lock, hop on the bike and pump the cranks hard and fast to make it in time to get a sandwich. 

I arrive at 2:50 and the chairs are all up on the tables, the lights are off save for one in the back and it appears empty. But the sign in the window still says open and the door is not locked. 

So I pop in and a guy appears from the back to tell me it is closed. I told him I thought it was open until 3 and and he said yes it's now 3 a.m. I was a bit mystified how I had taken so long, but I didn't have a watch and my phone was in my backpack so I accepted the reality that I was going to have to go somewhere else to eat. 

So I find a place to stand the bike and sit down and dejectedly root around in my backpack and pull out my phone to find a new place to eat only to discover that it is 2:52 a.m. per my phone. So I walk back over to the place and tap on the glass and show the guy my phone which says 2:52. He gives me a rude and condescending, "What?" 

I told him it wasn't yet 3am and showed him the sign that said it closes at 3am. So he then sarcastically said, "ok, so what do you want to eat?" Obviously the kitchen was closed and I wasn't going to demand food, so I just asked why he closed early. 

He told me that he closes the kitchen and stops serving food at 2:30 a.m. every night, starts cleaning up and finally locks up at 3am. I earnestly suggested that he should change the sign to reflect a 2:30am closing time if that is when he closes down the kitchen. So, dripping with disdain and superiority, he richly replied that he would change the sign tomorrow just for me. 

Bad mojo. Weird policy. Unappetizing looking place from the outside. Me no go.
author: Jono T.

description:
Mediocre food, but the service is horrible. I order my pizza slices and pay, nobody tells me they're not ready. No big deal, I wait. 15 mins later, I ask where my food is and remark I've been waiting 15 mins. One of the guys working the line comes back with this gem "why don't you wait 20. All you do is talk talk talk". Owner proceeds to tell me the guy was "kidding with you ". 

I'm not coming back.
author: Harry C.

description: Best Phyllis Steak and Chicken Phyllis i have ever tried!!! And also Halal which means always fresh meat!!!
author: Erkinbek R.

description:
Great freshly made pizza. I often order from there pizza for my kids, and they love it.

The appetizers and its selection is great as well as the deserts. I love their freshly made baklava.
author: Shahinaz A.

description:
Someday, when I am lazy, hungry, and home, I order from them on eat24. 
The delivery is quick and you get decent amount of food for cheap $$$.

The food is great. I Ordered burgers and shawarma from them and I would go for nothing else cause this is... AMAZING!

I will order again from them and recommend it to a friend.
author: Tarek A.

description: Save your money, go elsewhere. I ordered 2 slices of pepperoni pizza ($4) per slice. The pizza was dry and seemed like it had been under the heat lamp all day. The pizza tasted like some grocery chain frozen pizza they just reheated. I also ordered a side of red sauce that smelled old and had an odd taste.
author: Chris L.

description:
The best thing you can say about fresco is that if you buy something you can use the bathroom which, is actually also kind of gross. But sometimes you just gotta go I guess? It's not like there's tons of late night food here but I don't know if this is worth it.

The pizza is... bad. As is the meatball sandwich.
author: Misha T.

description: I ordered a shawarma plate, double meat, from here as delivery and it was so good! Generous portions, well seasoned rice and meat... I would do this place again! Funny, I should've taken a picture because I now realize this place is more popular for their pizzas!
author: Kat L.

description: The food wasn't bad at all. My favorite part of the meal was the rice and salad though. The chicken was just a tad dry but the rice was really flavorful. I would come back and try the pizza and the kebabs next time. Not very expensive either.
author: Missy X.

description: The best food around the area the food is good the service is excellent. Come to fresco pieza for a fast busy expierence znd you will be treated like a king
author: Belhasen A.

description:
I ordered pizza from them, which was advertised as coming with onion rings and a soda. When I received it, no onion rings were provided. Gave them a call to ask about it, and they basically told me "sorry, tough shit, no onion rings" and hung up on me. 

Did not appreciate their careless handling of the situation and will not be ordering here again.
author: Sam T.

description: Meat combo slice is the bomb! Jamal hooking it up! It's definitely my go to pizza by the slice on Polk. All them other places are a joke. Fresco is where it's at!
author: Chad L.

description: Great customer service and delicious food!! The rice was well cooked and the chicken Shawerma was really good, I liked how  they added vegetables to the mix.
author: B. Art W.

description: This place has it all: burgers, sandwiches,  pizza, pasta, salads, and my favorite,  the shawerma plate. Jamal is super friendly and makes great menu recommendations. The service is great, and they're open until 3 a.m., which is perfect after a late night out. Polk Street hangouts are not complete without a visit to Fresco. Best late night food around, hands down!!!
author: Carolina d.

description: Damm good food and they deliver til 3am . Me and a friend here at the hotel were hungry, front desk recommend it so we ordered and it was worth it . Salads and the shawarma we ordered was super tasty and good. If your up here in the City by the Bay check out there food . There delivery was fast as well.
author: Paakuma' T.

description: Pretty good pizza but service is mediocre. I hate that they don't take American Express and you need a $5 minimum. Pesto chicken pizza is good.
author: Natalie P.

description:
BEWARE OF YOUR RECEIPT - FRAUD/SCAMMERS: 

I was visiting San Francisco on 04/27/2017, I ordered my food based on the recommendation of the hotel concierge.  The food was delivered and it was decent enough for what it is.  HOWEVER, this is not a legitimate restaurant, pay ONLY with Ca$h if you must! The delivery guy had a Square App Swipe machine and promised to provide a digital receipt so I gave them my corporate email address as this was going to be charged to my corporate card.  When I swiped my card and I told him that I needed the copy of my receipt for business expense reimbursement.  I have not received it and its three weeks later - I have now called several times and have even spoke to the Manager who was able to verify the order that was charged but still has not sent it! Now when I call the person answering acts like they do not speak English! I think they are stealing credit card information or perpetrating tax fraud otherwise why cant I get proof of purchase!?!  

DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE - Buyer Beware: the food is alright but they are shady about recipients and/or prices.  If I had my receipt this would have been a better review but this whole shady receipt has ruined my experience so much so that I had to write this review.
author: Tap A.

description: This is by far my favorite food place in the city.. Very nice Mediterranean food.. I am in love with their beef shawarma.
author: Noureddine S.

description: This business is a class act, after I wrote my first review calling them out for not being halal but having a halal sign the guy in one of there pictures feelings was hurt. This was the same guy that told me about there halal and non-halal menu. He told me, "you know nothing about halal". I thought that was funny, look customers if they can't be truthful leave them alone. Any halal meat mixed with non-halal meat becomes non-halal. They make both in the same kitchen. Isn't that right Farouk. Lol
author: Ismail S.

description: Not very good... falafel and rice were super dry. The French fries look nothing like the pictures on the menu. They were soggy and thick (in the picture they are thin). Took forever for delivery.
author: Jackie R.

description: Stopped in for a pizza last night before heading back to the East Bay and was pleasantly surprised by the service and the pizza.  Friendly place, reminded me of a NY pizzeria.  Got the Fresco pizza and it was awesome.  Overall great experience and a good pie - will definitely come back.
author: Cory A.

description: Best Shwarma ever!!!!!! Everytime I come to this place it never fails. Super crackin and the Pizza slappin too.
author: Nestor M.

description: Ordered delivery, staff hung up before we could even ask how long it was going to take.  It ended up taking over an hour and was not worth the wait.  Pizza was passable but chicken shawarma plate was tasteless.  They quoted us the wrong price and did not even include cutlery.  Will not order again.
author: Arthur L.

description: Best shawarma in town! This place is my go-to whenever I crave Mediterranean food. Friendly staff too!
author: Deepa B.

description:
Um...I don't really remember much about this place except for the fact that I wanted some pizza at 2 AM.

So under my completely arbitrary rules of drunken, post-drinking pizza, you start at an automatic 3 stars and can go up one if you have chicken pesto pizza or prosciutto pizza.  Well, this place had chicken pesto pizza, and it was pretty damn good from what I recall.

4 stars it is!
author: Alexander Y.

description: This place is awesome. Especially after turning up at Polker! Food is great. I usually go with the chicken shawarma wrap or the cheese pizza. There is a $5 minimum so try to carry cash when you get in there so the only thing you have to worry about is grubbin
author: Greg B.

description: The best shawarma in this area  also u can creat your Owen pizza , lot of toppings , friendly owner I like this pizza
author: Abdoul W.

description:
Absolutely terrible. This review is based on a delivery through Eat24.

We have ordered from this establishment several times (almost every weekend...) and although it is never remarkable, because of the late night delivery we continue to give Fresco Pizza our patronage. We have ordered an arrangement of things including chicken kabob plate, kofta kebab plate, salmon kebab plate, pizzas, salads, soups, appetizers and sandwiches. 

This past weekend our order was awful. We ordered the kofta plate which was sub par, per usual. The meat was bland, the rice was old/crispy/bottom of the batch, per usual, the pita was stale, per usual, and the flavor of the hummus was completely inconsistent with previous orders. We also ordered a side of Baba Ganoush, which I typically do enjoy from here, however this one was inedible and tasted entirely of mayo.

I typically do not like to complain in situations like this because its late night delivery, I get that its hard to be nit picky.. however nothing we ordered was remotely close to good and we ended up critiquing the food then throwing it away.

I called the restaurant to let them know that I was completely unsatisfied and at first, the man who answered was incredibly hostile and questioning toward me. He did agree that the hummus was overly peppery and not right and by the end of the conversation told me that he would take care of the bill for me. When I logged onto my account I saw that $7 had been removed from my $35 bill... so much for being taken care of. I contacted Eat24 to find out what was going on and it seems that Fresco Pizza did not provide any comments on the order therefore it looks like I'm SOL. Hopefully this issue can be rectified soon. Although far from stellar, it is nice to have Fresco Pizza in our late night routine however at this point it will not happen again.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Never been to their place but I have ordered pizza at home more than 30 times.
One of the Top pizzas in SF!

Not that "original" wanna-be stupid thin crust, with almost raw materials that  the guy making the pizza is  skimping like they are made of gold.
This is a pizza that has materials, taste and substance.
If you want the thin tasteless flat crust that a few pieces of raw vegetables cheese and ham somehow got stuck on, then this is not your pizza.

The dip dish pizza with the cheese filling at the back is really something you won't forget!
author: Antony T.

description: Flew in from Phoenix and ordered food from here at 12:15a.m. We told them where we are staying and room number, they had our cell number and are 11 minutes away.  Gave an order for just TWO plates, one hour later no food we called and they hadn't made our food and told us that if it hadn't shown up within 10 minutes it wasn't made/or isn't ready. Was severely disappointed after seeing the variety and ratings. Not sure if I'll ever try ordering again.
author: Alexis R.

description: Love this place! Open late and delicious food. Jamal is awesome! They were quick and my order was perfect. I ordered on grub hub after the longest day ever and they made my night turn around. It was an enjoyable interaction, easy pick up and delicious end to the evening. :)
author: Amanda A.

description:
This review is for their pizza & delivery service.

We ordered the veggie pizza and it had very little marinara sauce & waaaay too many green peppers. Definitely the worst pizza I've ordered through Eat24.
The delivery guy made us go down to his car to get the pizza because he couldn't find parking. Maybe their Mediterranean food is better?
Won't be ordering from them again.
author: Katey W.

description: My friends both got a slice of the pizza which they liked and the service was fast. I actually ordered the Philly cheesesteak sandwich and it was amazing. You would think it's not hard to get right but I've have my share of Philly's and this place is up there in my top favorites. Its a good place to have a quick and filling meal after a long night out on the town.
author: Bhavisha P.

description: Amazzzziinnnggg Shawerma and pizza! The manager is the coolest guy ever. Must come again!
author: Chris T.

description: I came to San Francisco from Switzerland And i Loved both the Bars in Polk Street And the Food at this Late Night establishment. This Place was delicious And i would Definitely Recommend it!!!!
author: Thomas F.

description:
Cat food wrapped up. 
It's been good in the past, but the shredded chicken was very bland and tasteless.
author: Marc S.

description: We came when place was open , and cashier was so rude and didnt want to even answer . And he was trying to ignore us while we were asking about shawerma . Wont come back.
author: Jay M.

description: Ordered for delivery through EAT24 and food or delivery service was not good. Definitely not worth the $. Costco pizza tastes better. Greek salad was horrible. They charge $4 for a small container with lettuce and olives. Where's the tomatoes? Nothing Greek about that salad. Pizza was cold when we got it. Had to microwave it before eating. The combo kabab was cold as well. When we ordered it said delivery between 45-60 min. After 70 minutes I contacted the delivery service and they said restaurant was busy and will take another 15minutes. But within 5 minutes the food arrived and we wished we ordered dominos instead. The 2 stars are for the Oreos cake, which could be store bought?
author: Sflady S.

description: DEElish late night eats! We ordered the Fesco pizza and chicken kebab that came with pita, a salad, rice and a 'must order xtra next time' hot sauce. Very friendly and efficient guy on the phone taking the order, with an equally fast and lovely delivery person arriving with our tasty morsels!
author: Amber B.

description:
I ordered a cheese steak and fries. bill came out to 12$ with minimum delivery 13. I said I would just give the delivery driver an extra dollar. They said just pick a soda. When it was delivered, the bill was 14.50$ 

there was no cheese on my cheese steak sandwich. It was a mayonnaise steak sandwich with 5 fries

I used to like this place.
author: C.Edward K.

description: i dont really like leaving bad reviews, i got a late night pizza there. The dough was very fluffy kind of tasteless, the sauce was terrible, the cheese tasted like out of a pre packaged grocery store place. wont be going here again for sure
author: Tarek S.

description: We ordered a delivery from this place at about 1030pm. We were told our food would arrive in 30 minutes and one hour it arrives. Missing a side of fries and a side of ranch with the schwarma falling apart and the garlic bed a huge mess. I mean it's great that they're open so late and all but for the amount we paid for this food it was pretty disappointing. Luckily the manager was kind enough to refund us.
author: Sierra S.

description: Just ordered a late night snack, won't be ordering from here again. Their fries are a joke, barely cooked. They more resemble sliced potatoes that haven't been cooked at all. Soggy, raw, and totally lacking salt and flavor. It literally seems like they just chopped up potatoes and forgot to cook them entirely. Will not be giving them my money again.
author: Ggg G.

description:
I called to order a pizza. First, there is a MAJOR language barrier. No biggie. I can work with that. But he was talking so fast and wouldn't stop talking and when I told him I couldn't understand him he yelled at me. Then told me that I was rude. I didn't proceed. If you yell at me I just don't give you my money. 

Try another place.
author: Krissy W.

description: 100% fresh Mediterranean food ( pizza + shawarma) . Staff super friendly and helpful. Open at late hours.
author: Walid T.

description:
Awful. It took over two hours to get delivery. I called to check the status, and was immediately placed on hold.  For at LEAST five minutes, I was placed on hold, and listened to people placing their order, paying, and getting their food.  When I finally hung up the phone and called back? "Maybe he got in an accident. It's hard
to tell". Really?

Save yourself the wait.
author: Andrea S.

description:
Jesus. I've been a cross-eyed because of how happy this vegetarian shawarma is making me and my roommate cannot stop talking about how perfectly her chicken was cooked and I just ate a wrap that was a foot long and I need to tell the internet how much I lurve this thing. Do it. Everyone that works here is awesome.
Disclaimer: wrote this while super drunk last night, but sober me stands by this opinion. Yum.
author: Dede G.

description:
This is the closest late night pizza place to bars like McTeagues, Mayes and Lush on Polk... with lots of tables for sitting and resting your feet after a night of partying in heels. 

They have a pretty good selection of different pizzas available by the slice, which they heat up on demand for your order.  The slices are generous, one is all you need (unless you're a raging drunk eater).
author: Jing L.

description: Amazing scwharmas and right next the bars! Friendly staff! Open late with lots of options! Yummy food and I can't wait to back!
author: Kay R.

description: Very disappointing the felafel were like bullets incredibly dry.
author: Sahil K.

description: Honestly best pizza and shawarma in sf come here!! Great late night food after a night in the city
author: Lindsey M.

description: Don't bother eating here. I didn't check Yelp before ordering a hummus platter, but the low food score doesn't really surprise me. Soggy food that didn't seem fresh. I would recommend the flying falafel, there food is much fresher!
author: Therese M.

description:
So I drink too much and I end up here. The story is always the same. I get one of their massive wraps and consume it in the early morning hours, because they are open really late. I didn't care for Fresco at first, but the quality has gotten much better, and the staff are really friendly and cool. 

I usually get the falafel wrap or a chicken or lamb shawarma. If you come here for pizza and complain, you are an idiot. This is not a pizzeria. There's Napoli down the street that focuses on late-night pizza. It's not great, but it's what they do. Or you could head up to the far superior Victor's Pizza if it's still open (closes around 11:30pm). The burgers at Fresco are acceptable because they're cheap and they come with fries. But, like I said, stick with the Middle Eastern stuff.
author: Keane L.

description: Been coming here for years. They have always treated me great and the food is the best. The lamb shawarma is the best in SF and the hot sauce is fabulous. They make it from scratch.
author: Tom W.

description:
Review is for delivery service via Grubhub.

1) Grubhub first estimated the wait to be an hour. It updated to be slightly more than an hour. Delivery took a full 90 minutes.

2) Delivery guy calls me and tells me he's outside. I don't want to be rude so I rush down to the door. Nobody's there... Odd.. Okay... I wait, I look around, and then I start calling the number that just called my phone. Ring Ring. Then a car pulls up. He must pre-call people before he gets there.

3) I unwrap the shwarma, and I can already tell that it is barely warm. I have to put it in the microwave. Seriously?? I should have just eaten my Trader Joes turkey corn dogs.

4) My falafel ball was also cold. It was pretty difficult to cut through. I don't think I've ever had a falafel ball that was difficult to cut through.

Avoid.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Hard for me to review this one. We ordered a pizza and a shawarma lamb plate.  

Food was delivered to our hotel. Delivery time took 45 minutes as quoted.   However the driver turned our dinner plate on its side and everything was all mashed up together.

However the Shawarma dinner was by far the better of the two things we ordered. I wished we had gotten two of those plates instead of the pizza

The cheese on the pizza was so chewy and rubbery... You had to take very small bites or u would choke on the cheese.

Bottom line... Skip the pizza and order the Middle Eastern Fare.
author: Heather P.

description: Very friendly service. We are vegetarian and they made us a vegetarian kabob which isn't on the menu. Wait was minimal. Overall a good experience.
author: Sonia S.

description:
For late night pizza. Awesome. Could have been a little more prompt but delivery guy was cool and very apologetic. Pizza was still hot and sodas were cold. Would definitely order from here again.

For late night pizza. Awesome. Could have been a little more prompt but delivery guy was cool and very apologetic. Pizza was still hot and sodas were cold. Would definitely order from here again.
author: Kory K.

description: I was quoted an hour for delivery, it took an hour an 25 minutes. When the food arrived, I took 2 bites and found a giant bug in it. I called the restaurant and was hung up on 6 times. The person I spoke to claimed he was busy and didn't have time to process a refund or replacement. No matter how many times I tried to call back, he just hung up on me the second he realized who it was. AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS. You will be eating bugs and if you say anything about it, you wont be given a refund and will be treated with total disrespect.
author: Allie S.

description:
Quite poor. The food took over an hour and a half to come, not to mention this was at a time of night when they surely had very little business, and the food came soggy. They also forgot a part of the order, which made the experience that much worse. Besides the bad service, the food was awful. The falafel was inedible, and the beef shawarma was more reminiscent of a taco than a Mediterranean wrap. A horrible experience. 

P.S.
The driver also didn't even offer change after being so late, apparently he thought his awful service was worthy of a tip.
author: Ian S.

description: Staff Friendly and very feeling. Thank you for delicious ravioli and bread. It is easy to enter shops.
author: Miwa I.

description: This place has amazing food and so friendly people. I really happy with the food specially the Turkish pizza and shawarma are very good. The owner was an amazing person and he gave me a free soda just because he liked my attitude.
author: Pouya K.

description: This was the some of the worst food I have ever eaten. The humus was flavorless, the pocket bread was so hard I couldn't eat it, the rotisserie style chicken didn't have much flavor, the chicken kabobs were just ok, the rice is nasty, and overall it was just bad. I paid $29 and some change for my food and I was extremely disappointed. I will never eat food from this establishment again.
author: Libby Lu D.

description: Jamal treated me like a King. Had a great slice and went right back for the freshest shawarma I have ever tasted...and right across the street from where I jam every Thursday night.
author: Jeff T.

description: It's perfect for what it is. Cheap and tasty. This might be my favorite spot for falafel wraps in the city. Pizza is always on spot too. They have baklava as well. It's a serve yourself type of place, so don't expect anything fancy, you might even need to wipe the seats and the table. But the food is great, the owner and folks working there are friendly, and... did I say the food is great? :) I usually can't finish falafel wrap, so I eat a half and take another half home. Any time I need a quick and tasty meal, this is a great spot to grab it.
author: Olga A.

description: This place is the best. All shickabobs! The people are cool and this is the best place after bars.
author: Shannon C.

description: This is a good place if you're drunk at 2am. Thats their main clientele. Drunk bitches who are hoongry as sh*t after getting their skank on in the bars in the area. Pizza was old and dry, not edible.
author: SF N.

description: This place is my go to delivery spot.  The food is always fresh and very tasty.  It feels like they actually really care about the food they make.  I usually get one of the shawarma sandwiches.  Also try the dolmas and baba ganoush.
author: Ghazal V.

description:
I desperately miss a good shawerma, so I decided to stop by here after the post office. 6.99 gets you the most massive, carefully constructed shawerma I've ever seen, it was over a foot long.

However, I ordered chicken, and what I got was definitely lamb. Luckily for me, I didn't really care either way, and it was still tasty (get the hot sauce, it's great). A fairly odd assortment of items in the wrap (french fries?) and I was really missing the pickled radishes I'm used to, but it was pretty good.

I've ordered pizza from here before (the red eye deal is amazing) and it's great for its category, and they have some uncommon options for toppings. Onion rings aren't that great though, and I wasn't a fan of the falafel either.
author: Dani A. C.

description: Pizza was not very hot or topped with many toppings, just not really good. The service was also definitely lacking. The guy taking my order didn't confirm the order or price over the phone which is why I'm not surprised he got it wrong upon delivery. Overall, not happy about this place and do not recommend.
author: Selina R.

description: Fresco is the spot. Pizza is on point,  Sharma is fire and all the other items on the menu are worth the visit. The city is busy and if you are too this is the spot for a quick bite still remains great quality for your food!
author: Bazinet H.

description: Best spot for late night food on polk street. Food is on point and the Staff doesn't waist time preparing food/at the register. They just get the job done and keep a high tempo the entire time.
author: Amit D.

description: Years ago I was enjoying a night at Playland when I started to get pretty hungry. Conveniently, Fresco was across the street and I asked the guy behind the counter what he recommended. Let me say that I have not had a lamb shawarma as delicious since visiting Fresco. I have to say that if you live in the city, you must get a lamb shawarma from Fresco. You will not regret it!
author: Shanta B.

description:
God this place is awful.  No idea why I went back thinking that ordering a new dish might be a good idea knowing that my experience has been 0 for 2.  Proximity I guess.  I've been here three times now; the pizza is bad, the shawarma wraps are bad, and now I can confirm that the Philly cheesesteak is the worst I've ever had.  As soon as I'm done with this review I'm going to toss this sandwich and go buy food somewhere else.  There is no cheese in it despite the guy behind the counter telling me there was; they just put a shitload of mayo inside!  DISGUSTING.  There is more mayo than meat...The sandwich can be described as 70% bread, 15% mayo, 10% meat, 5% onions.

Also they have a sign offering 10% off if you show them a Yelp review.  Isn't that against ToS for this site?
author: John M.

description:
Well... the pizza totally SUCKS! 
BUT Fear Not!
The KEBOB PLATE IS THE JAM, JELLY BOMB-CHRON! 
Super fresh chicken and lamb - high quality preparation and presentation.
And the salads, sides, hummus, HOMEMADE FLATBREAD and unique rice that comes with it is great. Ask for a side of Tzatziki with your platter.  
So, SKIP THE PIZZA, SKIP THE SHAWARMA - GO FOR KEBOB!
author: Jordan S.

description:
BEST falafel I've had since I went back home to Lebanon. You can really taste the difference when falafel is hand made with a traditional middle eastern recipe. 
Great job guys, keep it up! 
A message to Other middle eastern restaurants in SF , GeT ON THEIR LEVEL !
author: Lena E.

description:
BEST CHICKEN SHAWARMA EVER!
I haven't had the pizza and to be honest not really down to try it because I am in love with the chicken shawarma! It's a huge portion also. My love and I enjoy eating all over the city so we usually stop at random places and share something. But trust me it's enough. I can go on and on about their chicken shawarma but then I'll dream about it tonight and be forced to get it tomorrow. Haha!
author: Rachel C.

description:
Food is okay, but good luck if you're ordering online or over the phone. 

One late night at work I made a fairly large order, the delivery usually takes about 40 minutes. I accidentally gave the wrong contact number when I ordered so I just waited outside for the delivery guy. About an hour went by, then another 30 minutes. So I went back to my desk and called Fresco back.

Guy on phone: "onhhh driver came but you no answer, i send him back"
me: "okay cool, thanks" 

Another hour goes by, no delivery shows up. I even asked the security desk if anyone had come by with a food delivery, they assured me that no one came.

So I call the place back and tell this guy my address and he literally started YELLING AT ME- cussing and ranting about how he was outside honking and he couldn't get out of his car because they were too busy.- I could hardly understand him because his English was so bad. 
Somehow, I stayed calm enough to let him know I still wanted the food that I paid good money for and he finally came.
author: Chris R.

description: my favorite pizza place. period. pizzas are always loaded with toppings, crust is just right, the guys working there are hella cool and friendly. i eat here almost every week, in one way or another (eat24, delivery at my work, or walking in). their shawarma is off the hook, loove their hummus, kebabs are yummy, even their burgers are great! PLUS they're open late :D
author: Kit U.

description: Delivery was 30 minutes late. Driver was unapologetic and there was a BOOT PRINT on the pizza box. Will never order again.
author: omar y.

description: Love the chicken shawarma with their hot sauce. It's so delicious!! Portions are hefty as well. You have to come and try their delicious food.
author: Mariah J.

description: Delivery took 2 hours - then the order was completely wrong, and that food sucked too.
author: Alex P.

description:
Avoid this place, even if desperate. Read for blow by blow. Be warned, you'll never get this minute back. If you end now, in summary: rude, incompetent delivery service, bad food.

Got into our hotel room in financial district past deadline to get room service (11pm). Front desk gives us a couple of menus, 1 of which was this establishment. This place won due to its inclusion of shawarma and rotisserie chicken. I call and put in an order for 3 plates, 1 sandwich. I ask if I can pay with credit and he says they will bring credit machine wit them. I ask how long they expect it to take. Guy hangs up. We are starving and hungry, but whatever.

35 minutes later I decide I should check on the order to confirm. They ask for the address.. Then to confirm the number is 409... I reply, no it's 449. They say 1249? I say no.. 4..4..9. I ask how long. They say driver has already left, so soon. I ask will he know what room.. He mumbles yes, I think.

Another 20 minutes passes and we get a call. The driver hasn't left yet and needs credit card info, as the other driver left with the credit card machine. I provide my card info and ask how long - "it's busy tonight, it's taking 1 hour to get orders out. I'm leaving now so 15 minutes."

15 minutes or so later, to his credit, I get another call. "What room?" 449 I reply. "That's why it's late, I'm on 12th floor. I'll be down."

I wait for him with door open, he says "you don't have to be mad." I reply "don't say it's late because I gave you the wrong room number." He starts to show me his scribble of 1249 on his notes. I proceed to not tip him. He hands me my receipt along with a four letter expletive.

I gather myself and start serving people their food. The 1/4 dark meat chicken with hummus and Mediterranean salad? Oh that's 1/4 chicken white with nothing else. The two shawarma plates? No utensils. We become ravenous and eat the hummus and rice/shawarma with a combination of dried out pita bread and our hands. Thanks! Also, the food was not good, but I wasn't expecting much. Shawarma did not resemble or taste like shawarma.

Avoid.
author: Blake B.

description:
I thought the spaghetti bolognese Dinner was good. However, I would have liked a little more spaghetti and meatballs. I loved the garlic bread with melted cheese.
I thought the Philly Beef Sandwich was pretty good too. Cheesecake also good. Will be sure to order from here again!
