author: Sonia D.

description: This place is truly terrible. Went in on a thursday night when it was relatively empty and they still managed to forget my one order. I waited probably a half an hour or more...which is just ridiculous- other customers seemed unhappy as well. On top of that, the chicken shawarma was subpar to anything i've had. Not even slightly tasty.  A regrettable experience
author: Kim S.

description: Fresco is right infront of Playland. I guess it's a place to go to eat when you're hungry after a night out. The pizza is already made, but it wasn't warm :[ The service wasn't that great either even though the place was basically empty aside from two other people.
author: Jeanette L.

description:
At 11pm on a Sunday night, we decided we needed food.  I was looking at my grubhub app and trying to look through yelp, then opted to call the Hyatt concierge and just get their recommendation.  They said Fresco's, so we went with it.  What was funny to me was the mix of Italian and Mediterranean, but whatever... we went for it.

FOOD:  The menu has an array of options and we stuck w/the safe bet of pizza.  We got a deep dish pepperoni pizza ... and cheesecake, haha.  The pizza was good and had cheese in the crust, which was not expected.  The cheesecake was delicious.  Sure, we drank a bit before, but it was pretty decent with delivery, so we were happy. =)

SERVICE:  We didn't' order through a person, but online.  The delivery first said an hour, then my email was less than that, and they arrived even quicker.  Good deal.  They came right to my hotel room and the guy was nice, quick, and knew that all we wanted was our late night food, haha.

Bottom Line - They're open late, deliver, and or on grub hub... the bonus was the pizza was pretty good!  I'd order again if it was the middle of the night, sure! ;-)
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I recently went over to this restaurant and little did I know it was a hidden jewel. Honestly you would not think much of the rest if you were to walk by, however the food is amazing. I had a Chicken Shawarma and it had all kinds of flavors going on... I felt like there was an orgy in my mouth and also have to say it was by far one of the best shawarmas I have ever had. The service was excellent and as well their selection of food made it very hard for me to decide what to have. If you are ever in the area and love shawarmas, I would highly recommend that you try this place out. The one issue I may suspect is that the owner would have to shooooo you out the rest for acting like a heroin addict. All I can say is Nuff Said... 

Jason 
Daly City
author: Jason M.

description: We decided to come here on a whim one late night. We had a fairly large group of 7 and all ordered sandwiches. The pizza didn't look very good, so we didn't bother to try it. Our group ordered, the steak and cheese sandwich, french fries, chicken shawarma and the lamb shawarma. Let me just say everything was just EH except for the lamb shawarma. The lamb was delicious and amazingly tender. The chicken was kinda dry. They make it really spicy, so if you can't handle it - tell them to omit the spicy sauce. But damn all the ingredients they throw in there is good and the sandwich is jam packed! Everything is made to order so you will need to wait a bit. But it is well worth it. I didn't see anything else that I thought was worth trying but if I was in the area again, I'd get the lamb sharwarma again!
author: Natasha S.

description:
When you see a place called "pizza & shawarma", you should always order the shawarma; there's no way they'll make decent pizza. Focus on what you know! And anyway, the last thing I wanted was pizza, and Fresco is nearly the only non-pizza option late at night.

So: 1 chicken shawarma, 1 hummus, 1 pistachio baklava. This should be easy, right? Order and delivery via eat24 arrived in very reasonable time, about 40 minutes. Good so far.

Hummus came without pita to eat it with, instead I got some other small bread loaf that I didn't recognize. Hummus was good but bread didn't do it for me. I guess you have to ask for pita? It wasn't on the menu. This was my "fall back" in case the rest of the meal failed, and yet was a failure too. There was still a ton of hummus left and no method to eat it. What a waste!

Shawarma was huge but falls apart very easily. The chicken itself was great. The vegetables seem to be a pickled red cabbage (?) which give that pickled flavor  you need for a  good shawarma, but it could be a lot better. It's pretty strong and kind of overwhelms the rest of the food. It was also bit spicy, which was unexpected but fine with me. 

Overall, I didn't finish it due to it's size and won't save it for tomorrow due to it's peculiar flavor. That said, shawarma varies widely from region to region, so for all I know this is exactly what you might be looking for. You also might get the option to customize in person.

Baklava was bad, extremely mushy. Have to wonder how old this was...

While the shawarma was OK and the hummus might be okay if pita was provided, I doubt I'll order here again. That said, with a few minor improvements, this place would be pretty good for middle-eastern delivery.
author: Jonathan D.

description: Great pizza and falafels, especially late nights after bar hopping. I really hope they get some better table cloths soon.
author: Rocky B.

description:
This place gets the job done for drunk food.  If you are reading this and can't make it through the rest of the review, yes, the water is warm and safe.  Jump in!  

I came here after-hours (uh... 2am?) on a Friday night / saturday morning, looking for some good drunk food.  Had my heart set on Shawarma, but unfortunately they only had pizza left.   Went ahead with a slice of pizza, order of fries, and grabbed a seat with my friends.  Overall experience was pleasant, with friendly staff - not super memorable one way or another.  

The crowd felt extra-friendly.  Perhaps, alcohol was involved.
author: Leo C.

description: The only star I'm giving them is because of their pizza. We waited 90 min for a semi warm pizza. The deal we ordered was not delivered....bad service....but ok tasting pizza
author: Mimi B.

description: Gross. Not authentic. Not clean. I love middle eastern food, this is far from it. They served falafel with mint and greens shredded inside, it smelled gross and tasted worse. We ended up throwing out both the falafel and Shawerma plates we ordered & walked out. :(
author: Tasia L.

description:
This is a review for delivery we ordered close to midnight tonight (on a Saturday). 
We ordered a Greco pizza (feta, pesto, garlic, olives) and hot wings. When our food arrived the wings were tasty, almost seemed baked instead of fried. Not too greasy, the spice was just right with the ranch we already had. 

The pizza was.....a crazy meat and onion/pepper combo???.....a huge surprise for us having ordered a vegetarian pizza (enough meat from the wings) :}
 
We called them and explained, and they said they thought that's what we ordered, and we apologised, they apologised, and they sent us a new pizza. 
I'm eating it and typing with one hand. It's pretty good, crust could use a few 'secret spices' but I enjoy the texture, and love the light red sauce. Note: I'm not a pizza snob. 
This place is inexpensive, tasty, and convenient. 

Food alone I would rate 4, but +5 for service
author: Cynthia D.

description:
Not even sure if it deserves one star.   Ordered a lamb shawarma wrap when it was not busy.  Shawarma is a premade food  that just needs to be put on a plate but it took over 15 minutes.  

Once I got it, the shawarma was only slightly warm.   It was chopped up when it is usually sliced and disgustingly greasy.   It looked like pizza sausage and almost tasted like it which made no sense.   

Wouldn't eat there again.
author: Mark K.

description:
NOPE.

burnt chicken, stale lavash, no tahini sauce. forgot my drink.


NOPE.
author: Bridget W.

description:
Piding for more.

Wraps and pizza are safe choices. Pide is a Turkish tradition.

Consider it a cross between an open-faced sandwich and pizza. Your choice of meat (chicken) is cooked with a variety of vegetables and spices. Then stuffed into the bread.

Glad I listened to the recommendation of the earnest and kind staff. If you are anything like me it will then be stuffed into your mouth. So good.

Five bucks will get you a meal more filling than a sandwich. Two bucks more and you'll have a slice of pizza to go with it.

Diverse, authentic and awesome. Just like the San Francisco itself.
author: Jason B.

description: Food arrived super late and the food was all messed up when it arrived.  Food was ridiculously greasy. Holy moly
author: Eric L.

description: Truly one of the worst meals I have EVER experienced in my 13 years as a San Francisco resident. I hardly know where to start. Just go with me on this: DON'T.
author: Christian E.

description: Super cheap slices and actually surprisingly delicious! Well worth stopping by if you want to grab a small snack and keep on shopping along Polk! Would totally eat again.
author: Cassandra J.

description: We ran into this place walking down Polk Street one night and hopped in for a quick slice. It's decent drunk food. All pizza is good after a night of dancing, right?
author: Andrea C.

description: Wow, so this place says they're open until after 2:00 am. A group of 6 of us headed over and they had decided to close 30 minutes early. We walked up just as they were sweeping and they told us they had decided to close early and wouldn't serve us. It's fair if they don't advertise late hours (3 am), but really bs if they close early and then are rude to wannabe customers.  Don't count in these people
author: Eric O.

description: Went in late night, and entrusted my order with the dudes in the kitchen. They recommended, and I ordered, a Chicken Philly. I am not a sandwich person, but this one is a sammie for the ages - super flavorful grilled chicken, tasty melty cheese, and just the right amount of peppers, onions, and mushrooms. I'm not an expert on how a Philly Cheesesteak is supposed to be made (I don't even really know how its spelled), but from now on, I'm measuring all of them against Fresco's. I'm not on Polk often, but from now on when I am, I'm ending the night at Fresco's!
author: Heidi H.

description: They were open! It was late at night and walked by. It seemed like a decent place so we said 'why not?' walked in and it was more than I expected. The pizza and fries were awesome and the prices were legit.
author: Martin C.

description: I'm not sure why people say delivery wasn't good.  I order from here often and they are always on time (or early).  The food comes hot.  The rotissierie chicken is delicious (crispy and fresh).  They have a variety of food and we have tried most and haven't had a problem with anything.  Love this place.  Glad they are open late!
author: Mercy G.

description: I tried to call and order a pizza for delivery, they hung up on me.  So, I ordered through their website.  My receipt told me it'd be 45 minutes.  At 55 minutes, I inquired to the status and was told it would be 5-10 mins more.  I finally received a cold pizza after a total of 1 hour 20 mins.  No apology just the excuse, "We're busy".
author: Brian B.

description:
Surprisingly not horrible. Looking at the business from the outside, it's easy to judge this place as a shady, sub-par eating establishment. I've bought a shawarma or 2 from this place in last 2 years but I hadn't been back in awhile - I guess I wasn't too impressed. Armed with a seamlessweb groupon and too lazy to cook dinner, I gave this place a try. I ordered the Greco Pizza and the beef/lamb shawarma. I decided to pick it up instead of waiting for delivery after reading some of the bad delivery experiences on Yelp.

My order was ready and waiting for me in under 20 minutes. The pizza was good. Not excellent but better than average. The shawarma was fricking delicious and huge - like crazy huge!!

I'll be back for more shawarma deliciousness.
author: Kiristen R.

description: I ordered a pizza via Seamless web at 8:08pm and it didn't show up until 9:48pm. That's absolutely unacceptable. Pizza itself is OK, but wasn't expecting much. I called Seamless when my order didn't arrive after an hour because I knew they would care abt customer service. Despite being ravenous I was going to cancel my order but they immediately offered a 20% discount which I thought was fair. However, the delivery guy didn't even offer an apology, even though I know through Seamless that he was contacted & told to hurry. Needless to say I won't be ordering from this place ever again.
author: Alex H.

description:
This location has been a string of unremarkable middle eastern places (with the exception of Tagine which moved down to Van Ness) but we've been very happy with Fresco since they opened.  First, they are open late and deliver late.  After midnight it's nice to be able to get something other than just pizza or Thai!  We've had their pizza and it's decent.  Better than expected.  The owner? (who reminds me of John Turturro) is a really nice guy and often delivers our food.

There are places with better middle eastern food but Fresco is more than adequate in taste and portion size and did I mention that they deliver really late?  The shawarma plate (or kebab plate) is a really good deal and includes a lot of rice, meat, a small salad and some hummus.  The wraps are also decent but should be ordered spicy for that extra kick of flavor.

So why 4 stars for such a seemingly average place? 

Tonight we ordered the shawarma plate with lamb and a cheeseburger for delivery.  The order didn't take long to arrive and we dug in.  The cheeseburger was decent but the lamb shawarma was a little overdone and tough, like we were the first to order it in hours so they had given us all the charred edges.  I personally like burnt meat so I was enjoying it.  But then, maybe 15-20 min. after we received our order, the door bell rang.  The delivery man was back with a whole separate order of very fresh, hot CHICKEN shawarma that we didn't even order!  He said that the owner? wanted us to have that order (presumably because they gave us old lamb?) and since they are only blocks away he ran it over, free of charge.  Got to love the special treatment on a $20 delivery bill!!  And I have lunch for tomorrow.  Awesome...  :)
author: Jon B.

description: Great shawarmas! Conveniently located across the street from playland, it's perfect for some post-bar grub.
author: Ross W.

description: Was walking with some friends and we decided to pop in here for a bite to eat. I ended up ordering the meatball sub. Prices were pretty decent and it tasted fairly good. Not a place that I'd return to, but not a complete waste of money. The friends that I were with ordered wings-- they were nothing to write home about.
author: Patrick M.

description:
So I didn't realize when I ordered on Grubhub that this place was middle eastern but...

Their pizza? Mediocre at best. The hot wings? Fatty wings with no "hot".

I'm Lebanese and we don't make pizza. I guess this just pushes the point. ;)
author: Jon S.

description:
This place replaced my former kebab/wrap mainstay, City Kebab, which closed down a couple of months back.

Looks about the same inside, except now they serve a hodge podge of things, from shawarmas, to pizza, to sandwiches to fries/nuggets.

Also they plan to stay open pretty late. If I heard correctly, till 3am on Fridays and Saturdays and up till 2am every other night. I guess they want a crack at the late night drunk crowd that generally makes their way to Le Petit Marchet, Bob's Donuts and Escape from NY Pizza.

I had some hummus with pita and a lamb shawarma earlier tonight, and I was not blown away. The meat was a little dry, probably due to re-heating. And the hummus was a bit salty. 

I'm not too quick to pass judgment yet. They just opened 2 days ago, and things are clearly not yet settled. The guys behind the counter were real nice, and when I asked if they had any arabic tea, they guy said they didn't, but later brought me a cup of that he made from his personal batch.

I plan to sample several things off their menu over the next week or two and see if the experience is any better. A lunch visit should hopefully provide for fresher and juicier meat.
author: Arash M.

description: Order took almost two hours to get to our room and they didn't give me the salad I paid for but despite that, what did arrive made up for it.  Will definitely order again, just make sure to get all my items next time.  Thanks for being open late =)
author: Reana L.

description:
We ordred the X-Large 18" Pizza (4 Toppings) and 12 Hot Wings

1. Delivery guy sucked, sat out in his car and called us on the phone to ask us to come outside so he wouldn't have to double park?!!!

2.Pizza is terrible. Very light on the cheese and tasteless and cold and doughy.

3. Wings weren't very good and seemed like they where made a few days prior. Don't do it.
4. Was giving the choice of Coke, but got a 2 liter pepsi (i guess not a huge deal, but still a bait and switch)
author: Lord R.

description: It's been my favorite place to grab a quick slice. Always friendly. Always hot and ready. You have to stop here whenever on Polk street.
author: Andrew C.

description: good shish kabob and the best priced cheeseburger & fires. Open till 3am
author: t l.

description:
I like their pizza and shawarma 
good food and excellent service
author: Murad A.

description:
You get what you pay for.

Hubs didn't want to cook and I was just lazy.  I hoped on Eat 24 to search for a place with the lowest delivery minimum. Fresco was on the first page.  I ordered a burger and hubs ordered a beef/lamb shawarma.  My burger was closer to medium well than medium rare and hubs shawarma was way spicier than he could handle.

I used one of Eat 24's many coupons which made our order total less than $10.  So I guess I can't really complain.
author: Irene D.

description:
This review is based on delivery.  The shwarma was huge!  But really delicious, and best thing is that they deliver until 3 am!  

Perfect for a post bar noshing, especially w/ such a varied menu: burgers, mediterranean fare, pizza, pasta, sammies.  The problem was deciding what to get so of course we over ordered, but the leftovers were perfect for the morning, ha ha.  Got the lamb and beef shwarma, more like the wraps you'd get in Istanbul late night vs the kind in a pita.  1 was enough to share between two of us.  Also got a side of falafal balls and hummus, really crispy and the hummus was pretty good.  And finally the Nob Hill pizza, great at 3 am and I thought even better the next morning.  I would eat that shwarma anytime.

I know, it was a lot of food, but it WAS 2:30 am and when you don't want to leave the apartment you don't want to take the chance that you want something else!  They came w/in 30 minutes and they take card or cash.
author: Vern R.

description: This place is awesome. It's open late and it's close to the bar. The pizza by the slice is great. It's delicious after drinking.
author: Peter T.

description: I've made it my new mission to eat shoarma anywhere I can find it. This was a DAMN good shoarma, pretty close to what I used to eat in Nederland a few years ago when I lived there. Great durum, good filling, SUPER FUCKING SPICY- don't ask for spicy unless you can for sure handle it, cause I was borderline and my butt was not happy in the morning, lol. The workers are nice and let us hang out inside and watch tv until our friends band came on at Kimo's across the street. Solid place.
author: Samir K.

description: Pizza is awesome. Great place to hang out!! Come here!! After bars! :) Sid is the best in the house, always with good service. Whenever I desperately need pizza he's always there!
author: Anette R.

description:
worst food poisoning ever. 
ended up in intensive care unit for 3 days because of how severe the food poisoning was. 

do not eat here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! don't do it!!!!!!
author: M G.

description: I went there on a Friday night and had a great experience! The food was great, the owner is really really friendly and there is a great atmosphere! I recommend going to Fresco Pizza if you crave for pizza!
author: Alison B.

description: The falafel wraps and fries are AMAZING! Friendly staff and good location on Polk st. I've only tried the falafel and fries but they have a very extensive menu.
author: Stefani H.

description:
I just moved to the city, and was looking to try my first pizza spot.  After digging through Yelp and Grubhub I came across a good deal that Fresco had which was a large three topping pizza, buffalo wings, salad and two liter for $21.  Not bad of a deal, and delivery was free.

Pizza was pretty good, but I'd say the wings were better.  Delivery took about 45 minutes.
author: Robert S.

description:
I'm so excited.  I find it difficult to conceal this feeling.  In the near future, I may be temporarily impaired; strangely, I enjoy this feeling.*

How is it humanly possible that there is a pizza place in San Francisco that hasn't been reviewed yet?  Honestly.  I ordered pizza from here last week, and it's near the Tenderloin, so many many many Yelpers must have tried the pizza.  And no one's reviewed it?  I'll take the little badge, but I also feel like I'm getting away with something.

The pizza is mediocre.  Ignore that for a few seconds, and go to grubhub.com to see the best pizza deal I've ever seen in my life.  OK, it's not better than any of the Little Caesar's pizza deals back in the late '80s, but it's definitely the best pizza deal I've ever seen offered from a non-chain place.  And this is in San Francisco.

Haven't visited grubhub.com yet?  You're so lazy but so am I, so I'll provide you with the details:

RED-EYE DEAL
Large 16" 2-topping pizza
2-liter soda
onion rings
$15.50 (including tax)
Mondays and Tuesdays after 9 p.m.


Yes, you read that correctly.  There are many places in this city at which you cannot get a 16" pizza with no toppings for $15.50.  But $15.50 for all that, plus the tax is included?  Is it too good to be true?  No, because I ordered this last week.

The onion rings aren't the best, but they're slightly better than the pizza.  It probably deserves three stars, but the deal and the fact that they're open till three a.m. every night put this place over the four-star threshold.

*Pointer Sisters paraphrase.  "One two three four five, six seven eight nine ten, eleven TWELVE!  Do do do do do do do do do do do do do do do."
author: John S.

description:
Polk St being one of the best nightlife districts in San Francisco, necessarily needs plenty of late night dining options.

Pizza options are everywhere, and there's a diner floating around somewhere that's usually packed tighter than Chuck-e-Cheese when the pedophile convention's at Moscone. But healthier options are few and far between.

Fortunately Fresco saves the day. It's conveniently located near McTeagues - where you'll probably end up at the end of the night, for better or for worse.

I haven't tried the Pizza, but the Shawarmas are fantastic. Portions are huge, I always save half for breakfast the next day. The only reason they lose a star is the insane amount of onions on these. I keep forgetting to ask them to hold the onions, but the amount is slightly excessive.

There's usually room to sit inside if you want to go over the night's drama with your friends before calling it a night. Because drama is an absolute certainty on Polk St. It's full of hipsters, what the hell did you expect?
author: Rishi G.

description: This is the best pizza on Polk street. Not only is the pizza delicious the service is top notch. If you are out partying on Polk this is the place to get food afterwards,
author: Danny A.

description:
After a groovy night out with the bros witnessing all forms of shenanigans on Polk st. We land at fresco pizza, in desperation for food.

We enter this tightly packed drunken joint of bafoonery, forced to bump and grind our way through the crowd, until finally we got to the register. So what if I had a slight stiffy, don't hate, appreciate, alleviate, initiate, masturbate. Anyway.. I ordered 3 pizzas, 2 cheeses and one veggie.. It cost me 9 buckaroos.

I receive my pizzas, turn around and begin handing pizzas over to my two bros, and in the midst of the transaction, I dropped a slice. Approximately 5 seconds upon purchase.

Here's where all hell broke loose all because an incompetent cashier assumed that every customer he deals with is a drunken son of a biznaatch.

Sani- hey my man, I just bought $9 worth of pizzas and I dropped one, can you replace it.
Cashier- eh you drop, too bad.
Sani- wait what? Have you ever heard of customer service? Why can't you replace my slice. 
Cashier- eh you drop.. Eh no.
Drunken bro- listen you ass clown.. Give us a new sanwich!
Sani- pizza. 
Drunken bro- pizza, ass clown!
Sani- ass clown? But why?
Drunken bro- I don't know, I'm drunk. I'll just sit down.
Sani- seriously man, can I talk to a manager or something. You're obviously have a deficiency in communication.
Cashier- I no deaf! Don't call me deaf! get out!
Sani- who called you deaf? I said deficient, anyway let me talk to your manager please.
Manager- what problem is?
*Sani explains issue*
Manager- ok ok talk nice, I give pizza.
Sani- can you please teach your employee what customer service is. And potentially provide a class in basic English, you might need it too. Thank you.
Drunken bro- ass clown! 

*crowd of people cheer*

Sani brainstorms 1 star review. 

The end.
author: Sani S.

description: The only pizza that I eat because for some reason the cheese they use doesn't make me break out possibly 'cause the cheese they use is not treated with all those unhealthy hormones. Whatever it is, I'm a loyal customer to Fresco.
author: Karla D.

description: I'm from Detroit and I know good Shwarma. This place has the best I've tasted since I've lived in SF. And trust I'm really picky. I can eat here a few times a week. Plus the guys are hot!
author: Daniel F.

description:
i'm not sure if you can tell from the name, but this place has pizza AND shwarmas, and they're both awesome. i lived off shwarma delivery as a kid, and this place has it pretty dialed. 

shwarmas: 
the meat is tasty and plentiful, they put enough of the white sauce in there, and you don't have to wade thru lettuce to get to the good stuff. my only complaint is that the bread they use is a little thin and tends to rip easily, thus by the end of it, you need a plate/knife/fork to keep from getting yourself covered in it.
author: Brody W.

description: I ordered lamb & veggie kebabs and lamb shawarma. Everything was very good. Seasoning was spot on and grilling was well done. The lamb portions could be a bit more generous. There was a problem with the delivery order. But these guys took care of it quickly; even brought something new to my house to make up for it. Very well done. Added star for doing the right thing.
author: Clyde S.

description: Great pizza, I've ordered many times and it's by far one the tastiest pizzas I've tried in sf. I like how they put cheese in the crust as well.
author: Zoe K.

description:
If you come here with the rest of the mob scene at 2am on a weekend when the nearby bars close, order the already displayed pizza.  If you order anything specially made, you may never get it.  They will give you a refund and some free onion rings for your trouble though.  

If you come here at midnight before the rush of people, they will make you a shawarma in a timely manner and it will be delicious, especially if you haven't eaten since lunch.  

The shawarma are a good size for those of us with huge appetites (as my stomachache for the remainder of the night could attest to).  I couldn't decide if I was disturbed or ecstatic to discover french fries in my wrap.  Obviously I devoured them, but it seemed so wrong.  Seating is minimal and you'll hear lots of great drunken conversations, so take in the scenery if you're a fan of people watching.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE SERVICE! I waited 2 hours for my pizza before I called. That's  when I was told that they "were busy". I had to ask 47x's (literally, I made Talley marks) for a manager. When I was met with "ya, I'm a manager but we'll deliver your pizza when we aren't busy" I got MAD! How dare you!!! Then to top  it off was hung up on and ignored for the next 20 minutes when I called hoping I would be routed to a real manager or owner!! Wow! I am appalled by the customer service! I can't believe how degraded I feel!!!! NO stars! None!
author: Katherine W.

description:
This place is right around the corner from me, and I usually hit the place up 2-3 times a month. The shawarma is huge. It's basically two meals in one, unless you are really hungry and tackle the whole thing in one sitting (it may leave you immobile). I tend to get it with lamb and the spicy sauce. They've changed up the recipe for it and I kind of miss the fries that were in it, but it's still tasty. The pizza slices to go get the job done, and much better than some of the other offerings in the neighborhood.

The guy that runs the place is extremely friendly and really values his customers. I think that's one of the reasons I keep coming back.
author: Adam B.

description: People are super nice. Food was amazing. Portions were large. Food was priced nicely. I didn't get the pizza. I went for the shawarma combo. That was super good.
author: Jason L.

description: Another great yumchie scrumchie food joint in the neighborhood. The original experience was with half of my neighbors falafel schwama..it was finger lickin good and filling enough for a meal.  The schwama has such a unique punch of flavor..very unique and genuine tasting (especially with some feta cheese). Great apps, including some homemade stuffedropes (like the spinach stuffed pretzel), generous portions of onin rings, mozzarella sticks and fries (yum salty shoestrings..sometimes steak fries). The one of a kind dough makes for a pleasantly different calzone and pizza experience that I would definitelyl recommend trying. Nice guys, family feel, with prompt delivery. Will keep going as long as I am in reach..my number one or two go to spot right now.tryyy
author: Adam B.

description: I was amazed that I didn't hate the food here.  I stopped there only because it was the last possible choice and I was starving.  I got the falafel plate and french fries.  Their falafel was delicious.  It seemed much lighter than falafel that I'm used to and I wonder if they fry it to order.  Hummus and Babaganoush were passable and there was also this unusual cabbage salad that we all liked but didn't feel the need to eat a lot of.  The french fries were greasy but we liked them.  Most of the reviews here are from people finishing up a long night of drinking here.  It's a good choice.
author: Joseph C.

description: good pizza, with a solid crust and a great chew. toppings are well integrated into the cheese. fast delivery, the shwarma is delicious. we order this pizza every few weeks
author: Lando H.

description: My roommates and I order from here all the time.  Their coupons are great and the price is always right.  The pizza is good, I had the Milano and was very happy with it, and they gave me a free soda.  They were super nice and very focused on customer service.  My roommate ordered the falafel plate.  I would also suggest pita instead of that bread, but otherwise everything was good.
author: Maggie K.

description: Got a lamb shawarma last night after a couple of glasses of wine at Pour House to bring back to pour house and continue drinking.  The shawarma was incredible!!!  The sauce, the meat everything was delicious!  It reminds me of all the shawarma I ate when in Vienna and Turkey.  These are 100% authentic, with the key being the french fries including within them.  I am dreaming of eating another one if not buying a bunch for a week!  INCREDIBLE
author: Adrienne B.

description: Ordered the combo pizza for game 2 of the NBA finals... good stuff!  Actually reminds me of Shakey's Pizza which is an all time fav of mine.  Wings weren't bad either.
author: Brian A.

description: the most vile aggressive leafleteers in the city,....SIX MENUS ON MY DOOR FOUR MORE ON MY GATE AND TWO ON THE GARAGE DOOR....when you call them to say, hey maybe your paper hangers are screwing you by swarming a house with so many leaflets, do you really want them putting 12 on each house..the neighbors report the same ECO DISASTER of all those slick glossy printed leaflets that cant be recycled and have to go in a landfill...the accented guy answering the phone ended up telling me to go fuck myself...hey buddy, your key word comprehension of english doesn't bother me one bit, I was trying to do you a favor...I was going to go down and try the food again just to see if IT was any better than the operator, called a friend in the hood, and she said no waaaaaayyyyy would she eat there agin, canned food, rude indifferent stff and diarhea make it a no fly zone for her...
author: Chris D.

description:
Having worked customer service jobs before, I know very well the stress and frenzy an employee can be, will be, subjected to. And at times, I've known too the pay-off... although... and let's be honest here, it is often thankless, and the pay itself does not seem to justify one's efforts.

I know it with with my great tap root.

And I know too that very often the thankless-ness does not come from the employers, but the customers! It is a great economic injustice that they tend to dictate if an establishment should succeed or fail. I am not one for passivity, or for clichés, but this couldn't have come any more serviceable than now: that tired, old, neo-Stoical stance of "It is what it is". In business, especially in small business, if you are to succeed, you rely heavily on your customers, and your customer service.

And having been a customer myself-- longer than I've been in customer service jobs-- I know what makes bad service and good.

I used to be a fan of this place, and can't seem to stop singing its praises to my fellow "drunkards, insomniacs and flâneurs" desperate for grub in the middle of the night. Back when I lived in the South of Market, they would, quite literally be very happy to deliver to me even at the eleventh hour: at two-thirty, two-fourty-five in the morning. The delivery fast and replete with smiles and pleasantries. I'm thinking they were new-ish then when first I wrote them a glaring review (there were, to my recollection, only three or four other reviews here on Yelp), and were excited to get a place up and running. I was more excited when I found an apartment a block away from them on Lower Nob Hill, and you better believe that there came a period when I just couldn't stay away. I'm still rather new to the neighborhood, and being a homebody, if I can help it, keep the weekend evenings all to myself, relaxing, although I've since grown quite aware that I've moved smack dab at the center of the hub of things. Well, that is to say if you feel yourself comfortable, at home, or one of the AAU plebs, or the raucous "bridge-and-tunnel" people. Needless to say these rats constitute the majority of their customers, especially during the weekends. I've been witness to the pandemonium several times, an obstreperous line out the door. In one such episode, the business was so frenzied that when I got to the counter for my phoned-in order, they had forgotten that I had placed an order for two items, but completed my transaction for only one. Not until I was turning around did they notice, and after some manic hand gestures from one of the cashier's co-workers, perhaps alerting him of his negligence, I had already exhausted my patience to fall back into that line. Whatever. No big deal. The Shawarma Sandwich was still good. Never mind those soggy onion rings, indeed my dinner was complete even without them.

I had mentioned in my last review the difficulty in placing orders (delivery or otherwise) over the phone. I may have mentioned too that part of that difficulty is, shall we say, with the, let's call it their 'cultured voices.' But the greater difficulty is the noise from within their confines: all that hollering amongst each other and amongst the customers. That's why I prefer ordering online. When came the time that I did, and arrived to pick up my order, they haven't made it at all! I expected an apology,-- as customary response, like I said, I've done customer service jobs before, and apologies are rarely meant, although the gesture is appeasing-- instead I got a nice scolding from the cashier, telling me that in future ordering over the phone would be best for them! But oh well... The Spaghetti Bolognese wasn't half bad.

In time I've started noticing their competitors. And if one knew my neighborhood, one knew there's plenty of them around. It took a while before I thought of them again. And when finally I came around, last night, their delivery service online wasn't working (not much to their dismay, I'm sure!) and so I had no choice but to phone in. Well, it was the same hollering, clinging-and-clanging situation happening, muffled by 'cultured voices' and a fuzzy connection, was it too late to place an order for delivery, I asked. No, he said, only if I would be willing to be put on hold. I obliged. I heard the microphone set down the counter with the sharp thud of plastic on plastic. I overhear the madness carrying on as usual. Minutes go by, I wasn't counting, but it couldn't have been less than five. I heard the microphone scraped off the counter and picked up, and then one last click before silence. I kept my ear on that silence for a good few more minutes. In horror? No, but surely in absolute bafflement. Could it have been so busy that they quickly forgot that a customer on hold was trying to place an order? Could it be that business was that good they could afford to lose this customer? Well then, if so, I'd be happy to take mine elsewhere.
author: Rho-p O.

description:
Decent place for the end of the night. Pizza looked good but I got hung up on some minor details.  The sign offered, Cheese, Pepperoni, Sausauge, Sausage and Mushroom, Veggie and Combination..... Now isn't Sausage and Mushroom a combination? I was a little drunk :) So I started to ask others in line what that meant. We all started to agree that it must mean something else but they could be a little clearer. One woman suggested that it might have veggies in it. However I shot down this idea because isn't a mushroom a veggie after all? Anyways I got a shawarma "wrap" which was actually a burrito I have decided. It was ok. At the end of the night it was heaven and less confusing then the pizzas (which they had run out of or I could wait 10 more minutes for them to make new ones) 
I guess I was the only person to order it that night because everyone in line was commenting and asking me if they should get that. A very outspoken group seems to come into this place. Good times :)
author: Greg G.

description: I found these guys on GrubHub. I loved it! The chicken wings are huge and hot (warm). The shawerma was massive & made for two. They deliver on time! Looking forward to trying their other items
author: Louisa P.

description: This past weekend I had some friends visiting from the East Coast so  of course I took them out on Polk street. On our way home we all stopped in Fresco Pizza. The atmosphere was excellent and the food was even better. The staff was very patient and enthuastic even dealing with all the drunk people. We had such a good experience that we even went back the next evening. Trust me when I say visit Fresco Pizza after your night out, you won't be disapointed!
author: Emily V.

description: Hello good n healthy fo z stomach, i a usual
author: Jonathan G.

description: After a night on the town, I was looking for some grub.   But I wanted something other than a slice of pizza.   I decided to try the Shawerma and the thing is MASSIVE.   It's like 2 feet long.   Not only was my hunger conquered but defeated!    Pizza and/or a shawerma.   You can't lose.
author: Norm P.

description: If you need a late night pizza, chicken wings, salad and 2 litter of coke delivered to your house quickly for $23.99 with tax ( mention promo coupon 101) then this is the place. Don't gorget to tip ( you probably would anyway). Great pizza and I'm very satisfied with everything else I get from them. I've had the Lamb Shawarma on other nights and it's done just right, but you might need to let them know if you want it not too spicy. Friendly drivers and I understand a key person was away for a while and it didn't fare well from all points of view. Now this particular person is back, the business is back to why I original kept their number handy for late nights. It's a winner.
author: Hunter G.

description: I think they should just concentrate on their Middle Eastern options - should be renamed "Fresco Shawarma (& Pizza)". I ordered their Alcatraz deal for pizza, but it was really lacking in toppings (more like sprinklings) and flavor. As Irene D. said, "you get what you pay for". I wasn't really surprised that it wasn't the mack, but I did expect better. Their falafel shawarma on the other hand was a little dry, but tasty and satisfying. Friendly service and good for if you are stumbling out of a Polk St. bar and need salvation, but otherwise, I wouldn't go out of my way to order from them again.
author: Barbara K.

description:
What a wonderful surprise. To find great pizza made by a middle eastern establishment and not an Italian one. Being Italian myself, I am most pleasantly surprised and they have won my loyalty.

The pizza is always right, perfectly cooked and delivered on time. They are all super friendly there too. I now order pizza there all the time and love it.

UPDATE: I have changed my original review from five to four stars due to my order last week. I paid for sausage to be on my pizza and they left it off. Both pizza crusts were undercooked. Consistency keeps customer loyalty. I will try other places again.
author: Michael R.

description: Wow I just recently went to Fresco Pizza & Shawarma and it was worth the drive from SFSU.  I have no idea where to start. I have to point out that shawarma was excellent remember to ask for it SPICY it comes out excellent, fresh meat (I had the lamb), fresh vegetables, and the sauce is to die for.  The service at this location is very personable and customer friendly ask for Jamal.  The price for the 1.5 foot long shawarma is only less than $8.00 great price point.  PLEASE TRY FRESCO PIZZA & SHAWARMA is was PERFECT!!!!!
author: Rajan N.

description:
I know it's new.
I know you're scared.
Be warned. The lasagna is beyond anything you have had late night. Sandwiches? Same. Their fries rival anything I've had by delivery.
Shawarma and falafel are what they do best - do the math.

More importantly, these guys care, and remember you from one order on - true service professionals in an SF service world that unfortunately is severely lacking. Try them out, and you will never look back to your other options, day or night.
author: jamie b.

description: I'm new to Shawarmas, and I wanted to try one because I watched Avengers.  The pickled cabbage, meat, and sauce made for an interesting combination...which I liked for the price.  Definitely would prefer a shawarma over a burrito or a gyro.
author: Ray F.

description:
The food was rancid. The man I placed my order with was the least competent idiot I had ever talked to in my whole life. I believe I repeated my order 4-6 times. I tried to laugh it off but my Caesar salad came with thousand island dressing and the cheeseburger was all messed up. I placed an order for delivery and when the man finally got here (after about two hours) he called and said "I'm outside, come and get your food" ARE YOU KIDDING? 
Save your money, don't eat at Fresco Pizza!
author: Windy Y.

description: The pizza is decent for San Fran but it needs more sauce.   I could see so little of it.  The pizza is better that Victors in the taste, size, and price categories.  The shawarma was a disappointment.  The turning cone of meat was not only not turning, it looked like meatloaf.  The server cut a few pieces off it and heated them on the grill.  That's not the shawarma experience I was expecting.  Service was pleasant enough. The walls of the place are clean and freshly painted but pastel green and pastel pink are troubling.  There is great potential for improvement here.
author: Soy L.

description:
Mediocre. I'm a pizza snob though. Ordered a slice of their pizza fresco which the cashier said was "the best". I only ordered it cuz it had pesto and basil (which I love), yet somehow these flavors were subdued. The chicken didn't have much of a taste either. Let's just say I was underwhelmed. Luckily I wasn't hungry at the time or I may have been upset..

However my friend ordered some fries and she liked them. They were crinkly. Though she said they were a bit salty. They also were 3 bucks for just a small handful. Yeah,  I think 3 stars is adequate.
author: Rasi A.

description:
the burger was your average burger (seemed like from a frozen patty). the fries were ok.

the chicken nuggets also seemed to be of the frozen variety. no unique twist or anything.

the calzone was good . it was different. the crust was a little thinner than what you usually find and had a very delicate flavor. i would definitely order it again.

delivery was prompt, professional, and polite.
author: Mark D.

description: Had late night craving for pizza n I was close by so I decided to place an order for delivery...the pizza never came. fail
author: Harry H.

description: Good middle eastern food that delivers. I tried the shawarma and falafels plate. Nothing really bad or special about the food but my beloved chick pea balls were a bit over fried. Delivery and service was good speed. Seems destined to be a late night munchies spot.
author: Ed L.

description: Tried this place for the first time the other weekend and you HAVE to get the chicken shawarma. SO BOMB. add hot sauce if you like spicy. the price is very decent as well.
author: John K.

description: This is the best pizza in San Francisco. The food is fantastic and the service is excellent. They are located in a great place on Polk street.
author: Chad J.

description: I'm always wary of places that serve completely different cuisines, (pizza and falafel?!?) and this is another case that proves my instinct correct.  Though the server was very warm and welcoming, and even gave me a free falafel ball taster as I waited, I won't be going back unless they serve up some fresher Mediterranean. The crust on the falafel was thick, and the inside was dry.  The wrap came with some old greasy potatoes that I would've skipped for some tabouli or lettuce instead.  The hummus was pretty flavorless, too.  The pizza, I didn't try. :(
author: N. L.

description: The nicest people in town making fresh Mediterranean food on-site.  Really quick delivery.  Give them a try!!
author: L B.

description: Terrible. Ordered a pizza, burger and baklava on GrubHub. They were 30 minutes late and got the pizza order wrong. Burger was obviously a frozen patty that was more like a brick, and the baklava is seriously the worst I've ever had. Incredibly mushy. Won't order again.
author: T. M.

description: Very friendly people. They take pride in their food which is quite tasty. Better than other places in the neighborhood and better prices. I will be back.
author: Pikea M.

description: awesome, awesome, Shawarma let talk about it, I'm from SANTA BARBARA south cal, last Tuesday August 23, I been with my friends in San Francisco, I can not believe it at all, we got inside fresco pizza place one in polk st, I was really hungry I ordered a lamp Shawarma  to go, man i ate it,it was awesome perfect, thank you guys you have a really a good Shawrma,
author: Samir Z.

description: Five stars for delivery consistency, reliability, value, and flavor. Its not the most gourmet pizza ever, but it is always HOT and delicious, enough to fill pizza craving. Plus the deals on Eat24 hours are amazing. I always get the 4 toppings XL pizza with 12 hot wings for under $25. I've gotten similar deals at other pizza places for the same price but this place is way better.
author: Monica G.

description: Very pleased with the lamb Shawerma. Get it spicy.
author: Josh R.

description: I am addicted to the shawarma---the cabbage and hot sauce make it so that any other shawarma just doesn't taste as good.  Unassuming from the outside, but the people who work there are super friendly.  Pizza by the slice is perfect and deliciously cheesy.  This is a go-to spot in the neighborhood and won't break the bank.
author: Sarah C.

description: Perfect place to go when I am hungry and not sure what to eat.  The pizza by the slice, when it is hot, is delicious and cheesy.  I love the shawarma, theirs has set the standard for others---be sure to ask for extra cabbage and hot sauce.  The guys who work there are friendly.  I've always just gone in, have not tried to order delivery.
author: Khoumeini B.

description: When I first moved here, the shawarma was really good, other than being stuffed with huge under-cooked french fries. The last two times I ordered, it was different. They seem to have replaced their nice cucumber/tomato/red onion veggie salad with shredded red-cabbage and (at least one of the times) grilled onions and bell peppers. Tasted pretty gross. I haven't been back super recently, and it looks like they may have changed up their menu a bit, so maybe they fixed it. For a place with "shawarma" in the name, they need to be on their game. I understand you have to serve drunk assholes all night, they don't care about the taste, and all those nice chopped veggies are probably expensive, not to mention it takes way more effort to make a shawarma than to reheat two slices of pizza when there is a line out the door. Just offer a different menu after 11pm.
author: Anthony B.

description: Fresco Pizza & Shawarma is unbelievably delicious and the price you pay is phenomenal considering the portion of meat. The first time I ate @ Fresco was the last time I journeyed for another traditional middle eastern type Lamb Shawarma joint. "Truly Mediterranean" or "Oasis Grill" iv had and trust me when I say I wish I hadent, especially because of the quality difference Fresco Pizza & Shawarma  provided. The Lamb Kabob plate or even the Spicy Lamb plate served a heap full of Rice, side veggies, hummus dipping sauce for fresh & HOT out of the oven bread. The atmosphere is always calm and never to loud. Great place to lounge outside on there tables to enjoy the Polk st. crowd when I first had their chicken Caesar salad fit for a king with two whole chicken breasts on top! O and they deliver Thru Eat 24 hr SF.com.  I gave a 4 star review because as a Connoisseur in food generally speaking being 6'2 215lb I'm basically stuffed and always bringing home leftovers. My hats off to the chef and owners for an awesome job back there in the kitchen.
author: Nick R.

description: Hands down, the best falafel i've had (so far) in the city. I have been searching high and low for my favorite meal, and no one seems to do it right but this place. and who would've thought, a pizza place?! yep! if you are a falafel lover like myself, do yourself a favor and spend the night bar hopping on Polk and go to fresco for their huge (i think its almost a foot long) falafel sandwich. best part....lots of hot sauce. man, i'm getting hungry thinking about this! so bomb. go there!!
author: Diana N.

description: i was just there an hour ago, i had chicken shawarma and it was soooooooooo goooooooodddd , it was thinking about ordering 2 but thank god i didn't cause it was huge , my next visit would be for the lamb shawarma ;)
author: Abdullah A.
